0.title: PayU terminates $4.7 billion deal to acquire BillDesk
0.article_body: Prosus on Monday announced that it is terminating the agreement signed by its subsidiary PayU to acquire Indian online payments gateway BillDesk for $4.7 billion. The decision to terminate the deal comes nearly a month after the CCI approved the deal. Prosus said certain conditions precedent were not fulfilled by the long stop date and the agreement has terminated automatically.

1.title: UK drops plan to scrap 45% rate of income tax for highest earners
1.article_body: The UK government has announced it will not go ahead with the plan to scrap 45% rate of income tax for the country's highest earners. The reversal comes 10 days after the measure was first announced. "It's clear that...abolition of...45p tax rate has become a distraction from our overriding mission to tackle...challenges facing our economy," Finance Minister Kwasi Kwarteng said.

2.title: Humbled & honoured: Devgn on winning 2 National Awards for 'Tanhaji...'
2.article_body: Ajay Devgn said he is "humbled and honoured" to have won two National Awards, one as a Producer of Best Film and one as Best Actor, for his film 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior'. "This is my third win as Best Actor. I feel elated yet humbled each time this happens," he added. Ajay shared his Best Actor award with Suriya.

3.title: Amitabh Bachchan is an absolutely brilliant performer: Rashmika
3.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna said her 'Goodbye' co-star Amitabh Bachchan "is an absolutely brilliant performer". She added, "A gem of a person who always argues with me as a reel papa." Rashmika said she's grateful to have worked with Amitabh Bachchan in 'Goodbye'. "It's been an absolute honour and this will forever be super special," she wrote.

4.title: He never makes you feel like an outsider: Jayam Ravi on Mani Ratnam
4.article_body: Actor Jayam Ravi said Director Mani Ratnam "never makes you feel like an outsider". Ravi, who plays Chola king Rajaraja in Mani's 'Ponniyin Selvan', said he met the "sweetest people" while working on the film. "I've worked with Trisha before, and Vikram is like my brother. Karthi and I have become brothers now. That's the bond we have," he added.

5.title: Honour for weavers: T'gana minister on Gollabhama sarees' UNESCO listing
5.article_body: Telangana minister T Harish Rao has thanked weavers from Siddipet over Gollabhama sarees' UNESCO listing and described it as an "honour" to the skill of the weavers. Rao is the MLA for Siddipet. Gollabhama sarees were mentioned in UNESCO's "Handmade for the 21st Century: Safeguarding Traditional Indian Textile" list along with Himroo weaving and Gongadi sheep wool blankets, among others.

6.title: More than 80 people killed due to Hurricane Ian, rescue efforts underway
6.article_body: More than 80 people have died due to Hurricane Ian. Hundreds of thousands of people in Florida and the Carolinas are left without electricity. The National Guard and the Coast Guard flew helicopters over Florida's barrier islands to rescue people. US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden will visit Puerto Rico on Monday and Florida on Wednesday.

7.title: We restricted them to 106 in 1st game: Rahul on India's bowling in 2nd SA T20I
7.article_body: Defending India's bowling in the second T20I against South Africa, KL Rahul said though there's room for the bowlers to improve, the conditions should also be considered. "Two days back, they got SA bowled out for 106...there was a little bit of dew [today], it's also a very humid place, so it's hard for the bowlers to grip," he explained.

8.title: 3 men walking on railway tracks in MP die after moving train hits them
8.article_body: Three men walking on railway tracks were killed when they were hit by a moving train in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar, police said. The incident took place on Sunday evening. The deceased have been identified as 26-year-old Dharmendra Yadav, 30-year-old Sanju Ghoshi and 28-year-old Rajkumar Yadav, an official said. Police have registered a case.

9.title: IAF inducts 1st batch of made-in-India Light Combat Helicopters
9.article_body: The Indian Air Force on Monday inducted the first batch of made-in-India Light Combat Helicopters (LCH) at the Jodhpur Air Force base in Rajasthan. The ceremony was led by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh. Manufactured by Hindustan Aeronautics Limited, the Light Combat Helicopters are capable of destroying enemy air defence and can be deployed in counter-insurgency operations.

10.title: 10-year-old boy rapes 6-year-old girl in animal shed in UP
10.article_body: Police has detained a 10-year-old boy for allegedly raping a six-year-old girl in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun. The girl was playing outside her home when the accused allegedly lured her and took her with him to a cattle shed. Police said that necessary legal action is being taken against the accused after taking him into the custody as per the law.

11.title: Medicines may soon get QR codes to check for their authenticity: Reports
11.article_body: In a bid to prevent the use of counterfeit and substandard medicines, the central government may soon launch a "track and trace" mechanism, under which QR codes will be printed on the primary packaging labels, as per reports. The QR codes will allow consumers to check the authenticity of the drugs while providing them with additional information.

12.title: 'Bomb threat' on China-bound Iranian plane over Indian airspace, IAF jets scrambled: Report
12.article_body: Indian Air Force fighter jets from Punjab and Jodhpur were scrambled to intercept an Iranian passenger aircraft that was moving towards New Delhi's airspace on Monday as security agencies received inputs about the possibility of a bomb on board, ANI reported. The plane was not allowed to land in Delhi and is now moving towards China, ANI added.

13.title: Centre should provide weekly money to needy families as social security: Gehlot
13.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said the Centre should provide money on a weekly basis as social security to all needy people in the country. "Why shouldn't families compulsorily get weekly money like other countries? This will help in running families...only those who need it will get [it]," Gehlot asked. "You go to London, America, social security is everywhere," he stated.

14.title: ISRO's Mars orbiter runs out of fuel 8 years after launch, loses link: Officials
14.article_body: The Mars orbiter launched by the ISRO in 2013 has run out of propellant and its battery has drained beyond the safe limit, PTI reported citing officials. The Mars Orbiter Mission reportedly entered a long eclipse period in April and lost contact with ground station. The ₹450-crore craft, designed to last only for six months, orbited Mars for eight years.

15.title: Telangana CM KCR to enter national politics on Vijayadashami: Reports
15.article_body: According to reports, Telangana CM KCR is expected to enter into national politics on Vijayadashami, which is on October 5. The particulars of the plan are being worked out and the TRS could be renamed. On September 5, He had announced that free electricity would be supplied to farmers across the country if a non-BJP government comes to power.

16.title: PE, VC funding to Indian startups slowed 20% in 2022: Report
16.article_body: The funding coming into Indian startups through private equity (PE) and venture capital (VC) reduced from 949 investments worth $45.4 billion in January-September 2021 to 1,016 investments worth $36 billion in the same period this year, Venture Intelligence data showed. The funding slowed a little over 20% by value in the first nine months of 2022.

17.title: Ghaziabad Police arrest 6 people for vandalising Durga Puja pandal
17.article_body: Ghaziabad Police on Sunday arrested six people for allegedly vandalising a Durga Puja pandal in Sahibabad. According to the complaint, a person claimed that his neighbour objected to the loud music at the pandal, however, even after the music's volume was lowered, the suspects vandalised the pandal and fought with the organisers, a police station in charge said.

18.title: Odisha CM launches month-long 'Jana Sampark Padyatra' from Bhubaneswar
18.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik launched BJD's month-long "Jana Sampark Padyatra" from Bhubaneswar. "The padyatra will be organised across the state starting from ward, panchayat, town and Assembly segment, every leader and worker of the party will go to the people and inform them about the development work across the sectors," said Debi Mishra, Vice President of BJD.

19.title: Margot Robbie, Cara's friends break arm of photographer taking their pics: Report
19.article_body: Actress Margot Robbie and model-actress Cara Delevingne's filmmaker friends were arrested for attacking a photographer aggressively taking their photos in Argentina's Buenos Aires, according to reports. The photographer's arm was reportedly broken after the fight. Robbie nearly fell out of a car because of the photographer, following which their friends intervened, reports added.

20.title: David Miller breaks world record for highest-ever score by a no. 5 batter in T20I cricket
20.article_body: South Africa batter David Miller has broken the world record for registering the highest-ever score by a number five batter in T20I cricket. The 33-year-old slammed an unbeaten 106 off 47 deliveries against India in second T20I to set the record. The previous record was held by Romania's Sivakumar Periyalwar, who had slammed 105*(40) against Turkey on August 29, 2019.

21.title: We need to improve in the T20Is: Babar Azam after 67-run defeat vs Eng
21.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam said they need to improve in the shortest format of the game after losing the seventh T20I against England on Sunday. "With 200 runs on the board, if we lose early wickets, it puts pressure on the other batters. This series was vital for us," added Babar. Batting first, England posted 209/3 in the game.

22.title: England finish their first tour to Pakistan in 17 years with 4-3 series win
22.article_body: England finished their first tour to Pakistan in 17 years with a 67-run win in the final T20I on Sunday, claiming the seven-match series 4-3. England won the first, third, sixth and seventh T20I, with 23-year-old batter Harry Brook being named the 'Player of the Series' for scoring a total of 238 runs. Muhammad Rizwan (316 runs) top-scored for Pakistan.

23.title: India reports 3,011 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 36,126
23.article_body: India reported 3,011 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The active cases in the country went down to 36,126 from the earlier 37,444, as per the ministry. The coronavirus-related death toll so far has reached 5,28,701. The weekly positivity rate currently stands at 1.31%.

24.title: Mitchell Johnson pushes Yusuf Pathan amid fight during Legends League Cricket match
24.article_body: India Capitals' Mitchell Johnson and Bhilwara Kings' Yusuf Pathan got involved in a fight during their Legends League Cricket match. In a video that went viral on social media, the duo can be seen arguing with each other before Johnson pushes Yusuf away. The umpires can then be seen intervening. Yusuf scored 48(24) in the match.

25.title: Surprised I'm getting this, Surya had bigger impact: Rahul on Player of the Match award
25.article_body: After being named Player of the Match for scoring 57(28) in the second T20I against South Africa, India opener KL Rahul said, "Quite honestly I am surprised, I am getting the award." He added, "Suryakumar Yadav had a bigger impact on the game. He changed the game," Rahul said. Suryakumar scored 61 runs off 22 deliveries.

26.title: 4 kids drown in tank while trying to save each other in Ranga Reddy
26.article_body: Four children, aged between nine and 14, drowned in a tank under Yacharam police station limits in Ranga Reddy on Sunday, police said. The children died one by one as they tried to save each other, a police inspector said. The District Collector has announced a ₹50,000 ex-gratia to each of the deceased's families, the police inspector added.

27.title: Bengaluru ranks 43 among 45 cities in Swachh Survekshan ranking
27.article_body: Bengaluru was ranked 43rd among 45 cities surveyed under the Swachh Survekshan, a steep downfall from the 28th spot in the previous year. While Madhya Pradesh's Indore was ranked first in the list for the sixth consecutive year, Surat and Navi Mumbai stood second and third. Bengaluru was better only than Chennai and Madurai, which were in the bottom two.

28.title: 60 cr people changed habit of open defecation: Prez at Swachh Bharat Diwas event
28.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Sunday said since the launch of ‘Swachh Bharat Mission-Gramin’ in 2014, over 11 crore toilets have been constructed and about 60 crore people have changed their habit of open defecation. She said that ‘Swachh Bharat Mission-Gramin’ is a behaviour-change movement. President Murmu was addressing an event to celebrate Swachh Bharat Diwas in New Delhi.

29.title: 60-year-old farmer dies of heart attack at protest site in Punjab
29.article_body: A 60-year-old farmer died of a heart attack at a protest site in Punjab's Gumjal village. The deceased was an activist of BKU (Rajewal), which is holding a protest over compensation for damaged cotton crop and availability of canal water. "We'll not cremate...body till...government doesn't announce ₹1 crore compensation...government job and debt waiver for...shaheed kisaan," a farm leader said.

30.title: Pune Municipal Corporation issues work order for e-bike rental service
30.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) issued a work order to a private firm to introduce e-bikes on rent and set up 250 charging stations across the city in the next two months. "The proposal to implement the e-bike rental project will be done in a phase-wise manner," said Shrinivas Kandul, head of the electrical department, PMC.

31.title: Muslim, Hindu inmates hold Navratri fast for communal harmony in UP
31.article_body: As many as 218 Muslim inmates and 1,104 Hindu inmates are observing the Navratri fast at a jail in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar for communal harmony, a jail superintendent said. The jail superintendent added that the prison authorities have made special arrangements for fruits, milk and 'kuttu' flour. The Muslim inmates are apparently fasting in solidarity with the Hindu inmates.

32.title: Man injured after high-tension wire explodes in his hand at Pune station
32.article_body: A man received 80 per cent burn injuries after he grabbed a high-tension wire while walking on the roof of a train in Pune. A video of the incident has gone viral. The man received a shock as soon as he touched the wire above him and fell off the roof of the train. He was admitted to a hospital.

33.title: 3-storey building collapses while demolition in Gurugram, 3 labourers trapped
33.article_body: A three-storey building that was being demolished since September 26, collapsed in Gurugram's Udyog Vihar. Three labourers are reported to be trapped under the collapsed building. Fire Officer Lalit Kumar said that the rescue operations are currently underway and that one labourer has been rescued. Two floors of the building had already been demolished, police said.

34.title: Man poses as UP policeman, extorts cash from locals in Firozabad; held
34.article_body: The Firozabad Police have arrested a man for posing as a policeman and extorting money from locals. According to reports, the accused, Mukesh Yadav, was arrested while he was accepting money from vehicles in the city. The police recovered a fake Aadhaar card, a fake ID card of Police Inspector, a photo in police uniform and other items from him.

35.title: Pegasus used to attack 3 activists in Mexico between 2019-21: Report
35.article_body: Phones of at least two journalists and a human rights activist in Mexico were infected with Pegasus spyware between 2019 and 2021, researchers at Citizen Lab said in a report. The findings noted that the three victims had documented alleged human rights abuses by Mexico's armed forces. Pegasus can be used to remotely break into phones and access information.

36.title: Alfaaz is still serious in ICU, please pray for him: Honey Singh
36.article_body: Yo Yo Honey Singh on Monday took to Instagram to post that Punjabi singer Alfaaz, who was hit by a tempo truck on Saturday night, is still serious in the ICU and requested his fans to pray for him. Alfaaz was admitted to a private hospital in Mohali with multiple injuries. Police on Sunday arrested the vehicle driver, Vicky.

37.title: Pak bowling coach Tait says 'When we lose badly, they send me to presser'; video viral
37.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Pakistan bowling coach Shaun Tait's reaction on being sent to the press conference following Pakistan's defeat in sixth T20I against England. "So when we lose badly...they send me [to press conference]," Tait said at start of the press conference. England won the sixth T20I by eight wickets and the seventh T20I by 67 runs.

38.title: iPhone detects impact, alerts police after car crashes into tree killing 6 people in US
38.article_body: An iPhone 14 automatically alerted emergency responders after a car crashed into a tree in US. While the cause of crash is yet to be determined, police said the iPhone detected the impact and called responders when the phone's owner didn't respond. All six occupants of the car, five men and a woman aged between 21 and 24, were killed.

39.title: Sanctioned Russian billionaire's 168-ft superyacht put on sale for £26 million
39.article_body: A 168-foot superyacht linked to sanctioned Russian billionaire Igor Kesaev has been put on sale for £26 million. The MySky superyacht, whose interiors have been designed by Dutch architect Erick van Egeraat, comes with a gym, helicopter landing deck and five cabins. The EU and UK sanctioned Kesaev in April in the wake of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

40.title: I had to keep the tempo set by Rohit, Rahul: Suryakumar on 61(22)
40.article_body: India's Suryakumar Yadav, who scored 61(22) against South Africa on Sunday, said he just went in to bat and enjoyed himself. "We were batting first, so...I had to keep the tempo that was set by Rahul and Rohit," he added. Notably, Suryakumar has now become the fastest batter to reach 1,000 T20I runs in terms of balls faced (573).

41.title: 3,200 MT wheat meant for public distribution decays in Haryana
41.article_body: Nearly 3,200 metric tonnes of wheat, which was meant for public distribution, has decayed due to negligence in Haryana's Kaithal. The decayed wheat is estimated to be worth ₹ 6.5 crore, officials said. State Food, Civil Supplies and Consumer Affairs Department Director Mukul Kumar said that the matter is being investigated and action will be taken.

42.title: No G-23 camp now, all leaders united to fight against BJP, RSS: Cong's Kharge
42.article_body: Congress Presidential polls candidate Mallikarjun Kharge on Sunday said that the dissenting "G-23 camp" no longer exists. "All leaders (of G-23) want to work together to stay united and fight against BJP-RSS. This is the reason they are supporting me," he added. "Many senior leaders of the party have supported my nomination for Congress President post," Kharge stated.

43.title: Astronaut shares pics of Dead Sea from space; says 'Intrigued by these straight lines'
43.article_body: Italian astronaut Samantha Cristoforetti has shared pictures of Dead Sea from the International Space Station. "I was...intrigued by these straight lines at the southern end of the Dead Sea - turns out it's a complex of Jordanian salt evaporation ponds," she wrote. She also shared pictures of Israel's Haifa and Tel Aviv at night.

44.title: 3 killed, 64 injured after massive fire breaks out at Durga Puja pandal in UP
44.article_body: Three people were killed while 64 others were injured in a massive fire that broke out at a Durga Puja pandal in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi on Sunday night. The deceased include a 45-year-old woman and two boys aged 10 and 12. Police said that the fire broke out when aarti was being performed at the pandal.

45.title: Rahul addresses public in Karnataka amid heavy rainfall, video surfaces
45.article_body: Rahul Gandhi addressed the public amid heavy rainfall as part of the Bharat Jodo Yatra on Sunday evening. A video of him speaking amid rains has surfaced online. During his speech, he said that rain, heat or storms can't stop the yatra. In the video, he can be seen drenched while speaking to the public.

46.title: Bihar remains poorest, most backward since 1990: Prashant Kishor
46.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor on Sunday said Bihar's condition has not changed since 1990. "In 1990, Bihar was the poorest and most backward and in 2022, it still remains the same. People here are bound to migrate to other states," Kishor added. "We've been listening...education and health services would be improved but nothing has changed in the state," he stated.

47.title: Punjabi singer Alfaaz hospitalised after being hit by reversing tempo truck, 1 arrested
47.article_body: Punjabi singer Alfaaz was admitted to a hospital with multiple injuries after a reversing tempo truck hit him outside a dabha in Punjab on Saturday. The vehicle was driven by a former employee of the dhaba, who was trying to flee with it over a payment dispute with the eatery's owner, said police. The accused, Vicky, was arrested on Sunday.

48.title: 8-bedroom villa on Dubai's Palm Jumeirah island sells for record ₹671.5 crore
48.article_body: A mansion built on Palm Jumeirah island sold for $82.4 million (₹671.5 crore), making it the most expensive home to be sold in Dubai. The villa is still under construction and will include a gym, cinema, bowling alley and jacuzzi. The sale of 8-bedroom mansion broke previous record set by industrialist Mukesh Ambani who paid $80 million for 10-bedroom villa.

49.title: We need to get our act together: Rohit on death-overs bowling
49.article_body: Speaking at the post-match presentation after their 16-run win against South Africa on Sunday, India captain Rohit Sharma admitted that they haven't bowled well in the death overs in recent matches. "It is not concerning, but we need to pick ourselves and get our act together," added Rohit. Put in to bat, India posted 237/3, with Suryakumar Yadav scoring 61(22).

50.title: Yuzvendra Chahal jokingly kicks Tabraiz Shamsi, video goes viral
50.article_body: A video went viral showing India's Yuzvendra Chahal jokingly kicking South Africa's Tabraiz Shamsi inside the ground during the second India-South Africa T20I in Guwahati. Chahal and Shamsi, who weren't playing the match, had come on the pitch during a forced break in South Africa's third over. "Yuzvendra...I'm coming for you," Shamsi jokingly wrote while sharing a video on Instagram.

51.title: GB Nagar police arrests 2 robbers after brief gunfight; 1 injured
51.article_body: Gautam Buddha Nagar police arrested two alleged robbers after a brief gunfight under Sector 24 police station limits and recovered two guns with live cartridges along with ₹5,670 cash from their possession. One of the suspects was injured in the leg in retaliatory firing by the police and was taken to a hospital, ADCP (Noida) Ashutosh Dwivedi said.

52.title: Indian javelin thrower Shivpal Singh banned for 4 years for failing dope test
52.article_body: Indian javelin thrower Shivpal Singh has been banned for four years for failing a dope test that was conducted last year by NADA's Anti-Doping Disciplinary Panel. Shivpal, who took part in Tokyo Olympics, was placed under provisional suspension in October last year after he failed an out-of-competition test. He had tested positive for the banned substance Methandienone.

53.title: Traffic advisory issued over 'Saddula Bathukamma' in Hyd for today
53.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police has issued a traffic advisory in connection to 'Saddula Bathukamma' which will be celebrated today at LB Stadium, Liberty Junction and Upper Tank bund and cause traffic congestion from 3 pm to 9 pm. The traffic police requested people to avoid 20 junctions where traffic congestion is expected to be heavy, like Basheerbagh, Khairatabad and PCR Junction.

54.title: Expert panel to approve artwork themes for Mumbai bridges to be set up
54.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to set up an expert advisory panel for approving themes for murals, paintings, artworks and graffiti on the existing bridges in Mumbai. "There are so many bridges like Hancock and Carnac that have a history of more than 100 years. We need to carefully restore their heritage," a BMC official said.

55.title: Real Madrid Prez backs Super League using Nadal & Djokovic's example
55.article_body: Real Madrid President Florentino Perez has reportedly backed the Super League by using the example of tennis stars Rafael Nadal, Roger Federer and Novak Djokovic. "Nadal and Djokovic have played against 59 times...This has boosted tennis...Real Madrid and Liverpool have only met 9 times in 67 years," said Perez. UEFA had threatened to blacklist any club that pursued the idea.

56.title: Man Utd fans reportedly leave at half-time after City scored 4 goals
56.article_body: Some Manchester United fans reportedly left the Etihad Stadium at half-time during the team's match against Manchester City. Two goals each from Erling Haaland and Phil Foden had put City 4-0 ahead at half-time on Sunday. The match ended 6-3 for City with Haaland and Foden scoring a hat-trick and Anthony Martial scoring two goals for United.

57.title: You need to listen to me: Hamilton to Mercedes during Singapore GP
57.article_body: Mercedes F1 driver Lewis Hamilton got angry at his team during the Singapore Grand Prix over tyre choices leading to him being passed by Ferrari's Carlos Sainz in the opening laps. "I told you about these tyres, in future you need to listen to me," said Hamilton over the team radio. After starting third, Hamilton finished the race in ninth.

58.title: Logistical challenges impact Tesla's EV deliveries in Q3
58.article_body: Tesla Inc said that electric vehicle deliveries in the third quarter were lower than expected and said they were impacted due to logistical challenges. The company delivered a record 3,43,830 EVs, lesser than the 3,59,162 expected, according to Refinitiv. "Historically, our delivery volumes have skewed towards the end of each quarter due to regional batch building of cars," Tesla said.

59.title: She's like a sister to me: Hima on 100m National Games gold medallist Jyothi
59.article_body: Sprinter Hima Das praised Jyothi Yarraji after she clinched the gold medal in the 100-metre final at 36th National Games. "Jyothi is like a sister to me. I was the happiest to see her perform so well. She listens to me...as a person, she's really nice," said Hima. Jyothi clocked 11.51s, while Hima finished seventh with a timing of 11.74s.

60.title: Finance Ministry to launch special financial inclusion drive from Oct 15
60.article_body: The Finance Ministry took to Twitter to announce a special financial inclusion drive to achieve saturation bank accounts and expansion of Kisan Credit Card coverage. The drive will run from October 15 to November 26 and focus on mobile/Aadhaar seeding of existing accounts with special focus on making small accounts normal accounts by doing full KYC.

61.title: India invites US firms to invest in oil and gas production at investors meet
61.article_body: Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas (MoPNG) showcased India's fiscal policies and conducive environment to attract US firms to invest in India's energy and petroleum sector during a two-day investors meet in Houston. MoPNG Secretary Pankaj Jain, in his address, highlighted India's offering of discovered fields and assured an open-door policy to resolve any issue faced by the industry.

62.title: India win a T20I series against SA on home soil for 1st time ever, break multiple records
62.article_body: India defeated South Africa by 16 runs to take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series. It's the first time that India clinched a T20I series against South Africa at home. India recorded their highest-ever T20I total (237/3) against South Africa. Suryakumar Yadav became the fastest batter to reach 1,000 T20I runs in terms of balls faced (573).

63.title: Heavy rainfall warning issued for several states for next 4 days, list released
63.article_body: The IMD has stated that heavy rainfall is very likely over Jharkhand, West Bengal, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura on October 3 and 4. It's very likely over Odisha till October 6. Andhra Pradesh, Bihar and Chhattisgarh may witness it on October 4 and 5. Telangana, UP and Madhya Pradesh may witness it on October 5 and 6.

64.title: Life without AR will soon be unthinkable: Apple CEO Tim Cook
64.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook in a recent interview said that soon we will be looking at life before Augmented Reality (AR). "AR apps are already in the App Store, but the possibilities will go much, much further," he said. Calling it "a profound technology", Cook said that AR will soon affect everything including teaching and medicine.

65.title: TRAI to propose unified KYC system to stop fraudulent calls: Chairman
65.article_body: TRAI Chairman PD Vaghela said TRAI is planning to set up a unified know-your-customer system, which should be accessible by all telecom operators, to check fraudulent callers and spammers. Speaking at India Mobile Congress, Vaghela said spammers have started using multiple numbers and proxy servers to call people and TRAI will use AI and machine learning to detect them.

66.title: What are the features of Light Combat Helicopters that'll be inducted tomorrow?
66.article_body: The Indian Air Force (IAF) will formally induct the first batch of the made-in-India Light Combat Helicopters (LCH) on Monday. The helicopters are primarily designed for deployment in high-altitude regions and have stealth features, armour protection, night attack capability and crash-worthy landing gear for better survivability. They can operate at an altitude of up to 5,000 metres with weapons.

67.title: Agarwal rushed to hospital after being hit on the head during Irani Cup
67.article_body: India batter Mayank Agarwal was reportedly rushed to the hospital after being hit on his head by a cricket ball during the Irani Cup game in Rajkot. Mayank was reportedly taken for a precautionary scan after being hit on the head with a throw. The 31-year-old scored 11 off 14 balls on Saturday for Rest of India (ROI) against Saurashtra.

68.title: 1st ever 2-day startup expo at Jammu ends, Jitendra Singh shares video
68.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh took to Twitter to share a video of the first-ever two-day startup expo in Jammu which he inaugurated. Singh said that preference for government jobs is proving to be an impediment to startup culture. During his two-day visit to Jammu, Kathua and Udhampur, he also attended a science exhibition by school students.

69.title: Honey Singh shares pic of singer Alfaaz injured after attack, warns attackers
69.article_body: Yo Yo Honey Singh took to Instagram to share a picture of Punjabi singer Alfaaz who was hospitalised after being injured in an attack. "My brother Alfaaz (was) attacked last night, whoever planned this...I won't let u go!...Everyone pls pray for him," he wrote. Celebrities wished a speedy recovery to Alfaaz in the comments, with actress Hina Khan writing, "Prayers".

70.title: Wow, what a feeling: Foden on his 1st hat-trick for Manchester City
70.article_body: Following his hat-trick in Manchester City's 6-3 win against Manchester United in the Premier League, Manchester City midfielder Phil Foden tweeted, "So grateful to have got my first hat-trick for City and in the derby too!" He added, "Wow - what a feeling! Manchester is blue." Foden's teammate Erling Haaland also scored a hat-trick at the Etihad Stadium.

71.title: Shri Tulsi Tanti one of the foremost believers in Aatmanirbharta: Adani
71.article_body: Chairman of Adani Group, Gautam Adani took to Twitter to condole the death of Founder and Chairman of Suzlon Energy, Tulsi Tanti. Calling him one of the foremost believers in Aatmanirbharta, Adani called Tanti a "gifted visionary who proved that India could be a global player in the wind energy space." Tulsi Tanti passed away due to cardiac arrest.

72.title: His oxygen levels decreased a little bit: SP on Mulayam's health
72.article_body: Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav's oxygen levels decreased a little bit but there is no need to worry as per doctors, party leader Rakesh Yadav said. He added that Mulayam Singh's routine checkup is being done daily. Mulayam has been shifted to the intensive care unit at the Medanta Hospital in Gurugram.

73.title: Real angered being tagged as Haaland's third choice transfer: Report
73.article_body: Real Madrid have reportedly been angered by the Manchester City forward Erling Haaland's father saying that the La Liga club was their third choice transfer. Haaland's personal team reportedly had a scoring system on which club the striker should join and Madrid scored six out of 10. Real are reportedly not pleased with their name being used in such scenarios.

74.title: Can't ignore lack of confidence within team: Liverpool manager Klopp
74.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said he "can't ignore the fact" that his team is suffering from a lack of confidence and momentum. "I'm not sure if concerning is the right word... We are under pressure...We have to perform more consistently," said Klopp. Liverpool is ninth in the league table with 10 points from seven games, having won only twice.

75.title: Kohli denies single in last over, asks Karthik to keep hitting despite batting on 49*
75.article_body: Virat Kohli denied Dinesh Karthik's offer to take single and asked him to attack the bowlers during India's last over despite being on 49*(28) in second T20I against South Africa. A video of the same has gone viral, with fans calling Kohli "selfless". Karthik slammed 16 runs in the last over as India put up a 237-run total.

76.title: We condemn this hate crime: India as Bhagavad Gita Park sign vandalised in Canada
76.article_body: The sign of a park named after the Bhagavad Gita was vandalised in Canada, following which the Indian High Commission in Ottawa issued a statement condemning the "hate crime". "We urge Canadian authorities and Peel Police to investigate and take prompt action on the perpetrators," it said. The government recently warned that hate crimes against Indians are rising in Canada.

77.title: What are India's 5 highest totals in T20I cricket?
77.article_body: India on Sunday recorded their fourth-highest T20I total after registering 237/3 against South Africa in Guwahati. India posted their highest-ever T20I total (260/5) against Sri Lanka in Indore on December 22, 2017. India's second-highest and third-highest T20I totals of 244/4 and 240/3, respectively, came against West Indies. India's fifth-highest T20I total (225/7) came against Ireland in June.

78.title: That's true: Mani on if Rajinikanth wanted to be part of 'Ponniyin...'
78.article_body: Filmmaker Mani Ratnam has said that it's true that he rejected actor Rajinikanth, who wanted to be part of 'Ponniyin Selvan'. "It has to be honest to the story...I can't bring in a huge superstar in between this and so I told him that I will be taking a rain check with him," Mani stated. The film features actor Vikram.

79.title: Rajamouli gets standing ovation during RRR screening in US, shares video
79.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli received a standing ovation during the screening of 'RRR' in the Chinese theatre in Los Angeles. The filmmaker took to Twitter and shared the video. Along with the video, he wrote, "Your adoration and applause towards my heroes, my film and me were enormous." The film featured Ram Charan and Jr NTR.

80.title: Disappointed with the decision: Xiaomi on ED seizing assets
80.article_body: Xiaomi said that the company is "disappointed with the decision" of FEMA authority, which approved an order of seizure of over ₹5,551 crore worth of deposits. The company said over 84% of the ₹5,551.27 crore were royalty payments made to US company Qualcomm. "We believe our royalty payments and statements to the bank are all legitimate and truthful," Xiaomi said.

81.title: Will announce party soon after padayatra: Prashant Kishor
81.article_body: After embarking on a 3,500-km-long padayatra from Bihar's West Champaran, poll strategist Prashant Kishor said that he will announce a political party after the yatra's culmination. "I have already announced that I will not lead it (party). I will neither be elected nor selected. But it will have a leader who will be selected from among its workers," Kishor said.

82.title: 1 man arrested in Alwar gang-rape case in Rajasthan
82.article_body: The police have arrested one man in connection with the alleged gang-rape of a 16-year-old by eight men in Rajasthan's Alwar district. They had also extorted ₹50,000 from her and circulated the video of the sexual assault online. "One of the accused identified as Akram has been detained. He is being interrogated," said Circle Officer Kishangarh Bas Atul Agre.

83.title: Worried about Mulayam Singh Yadav's health: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin
83.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin has expressed concern over the health condition of Samajwadi Party's founder, Mulayam Singh Yadav. "Worried about the health of Former UP CM and SP leader Thiru Mulayam Singh. Hoping that he makes a full and quick recovery," CM Stalin said. The 82-year-old Mainpuri MP was shifted to Medanta hospital in Gurugram after his health deteriorated.

84.title: Indore jail inmates play dandiya to celebrate cleanest city tag
84.article_body: A day after Indore was adjudged the cleanest city in India, inmates of the Indore Central Jail played 'dandiya' to celebrate the triumph. Officials said all prisoners, male and female, participated in the event attended by the Madhya Pradesh Culture Minister Usha Thakur and Indore Police Commissioner. Thakur was also presented with a picture by a prisoner during the event.

85.title: Raj woman demands ₹10 lakh ransom over intimate pics, videos of man
85.article_body: A woman in Rajasthan has been booked for demanding ₹10 lakh ransom from a man, threatening to share his intimate pictures. The woman had promised to marry him. She took intimate pictures of the man and threatened to share them if she didn't get the ransom. She sent the photos to his relatives and friends after he refused to pay.

86.title: Rajasthan Police revokes transfer order stating constables' caste
86.article_body: The Rajasthan Police in Tonk district had to withdraw a transfer order after criticism for mentioning the caste of the eight constables in the list. "It was an unintentional mistake...a clerical mistake. I take the responsibility," said SP, Tonk, Manish Tripathi. The BJP claimed the police were being "politically used" and that the Congress was "encouraging casteism in police".

87.title: Assam's Kaziranga National Park reopens for tourists
87.article_body: Kaziranga National Park and Tiger Reserve in Assam, which is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, was reopened for tourists on October 2. The national park had been shut since May for tourists due to flooding and rains. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma and Isha Foundation founder Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev declared the national park open for tourists on September 22.

88.title: Ram Charan said 'I want to be with you in same frame': Salman on 'Kisi...'
88.article_body: Actor Salman Khan revealed Ram Charan told him that he wants to do a cameo in his film 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan'. "He said 'I want to be with you in the same frame'. I thought he was...kidding...I said we'll talk about this tomorrow," he stated. Salman added Ram got his vanity van and costume next morning.

89.title: ₹40/day for every cow if AAP voted to power in Gujarat: Kejriwal
89.article_body: AAP National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal promised ₹40 per day for the upkeep of every cow in Gujarat if the party comes to power in the state. He also promised a shelter home for non-milch cattle in every district of the state. Addressing the controversy about the Ahmedabad auto-rickshaw driver, Kejriwal said he will not turn down an invite from anyone.

90.title: Volunteer work during pandemic helped PFI widen presence: Maha Police
90.article_body: Maharashtra Police said work done by PFI volunteers during the COVID-19 pandemic helped the organisation widen its presence in the state. PFI volunteered to perform the last rites of those who died due to COVID-19 and would volunteer during other natural calamities, said the police. The group had members in at least 22 districts of Maharashtra when it was banned.

91.title: MIT researchers build an underwater camera powered by sound
91.article_body: The researchers at MIT have created a battery-free and wireless underwater camera to image the underwater world. Powered by underwater sound, the camera captures colour images at ultra-low power and transmits them wirelessly to a remote receiver. They claim their camera consumes 1,00,000 times less energy than state-of-the-art low-power underwater imaging systems.

92.title: Sharad Kelkar to voice actor Prabhas in Adipurush's Hindi version
92.article_body: Actor Sharad Kelkar will voice actor Prabhas in the Hindi version of 'Adipurush'. Sharad had previously voiced Prabhas in SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali' franchise. 'Adipurush', which is directed by Om Raut, will feature actress Kriti Sanon as Sita and actor Saif Ali Khan as Raavan. Prabhas will play the role of Lord Ram in the film.

93.title: No arrest warrant received over web series 'XXX', reports are false: Ekta Kapoor's lawyer
93.article_body: After reports claimed that Bihar's Begusarai court issued arrest warrants against Ekta Kapoor and her mother Shobha Kapoor, Ekta's lawyer in a statement said the reports are "false" and "inaccurate". "No arrest warrants have been received by Ekta or Shobha," the statement read. A complaint was reportedly lodged against the web series in Bihar over alleged objectionable scenes insulting Army.

94.title: Twitter launches 'immersive media viewer', similar to TikTok
94.article_body: Twitter has added full screen vertical videos to its app or an 'immersive media viewer' similar to TikTok and Instagram Reels. Twitter will also launch a video carousel in its 'Explore' tab for trending videos. "Videos are a huge part of the public conversation, and they're one of the most engaging ways people can express themselves online," Twitter said.

95.title: Member of PFI, Tablighi Jamaat arrested in UP's Ayodhya
95.article_body: An activist of the banned outfit, PFI, was arrested in UP's Ayodhya for allegedly being involved in anti-national activities and provoking Muslims. The accused, Mohammad Zaid, is also an active member of the Tablighi Jamaat, police said. Zaid's father, Mohammed Haneef, has claimed that police had kept his son under illegal detention for the past four days.

96.title: Haaland, Foden net hat-tricks as Man City beat Man United 6-3 in PL
96.article_body: Erling Haaland and Phil Foden both scored derby hat-tricks as Manchester City beat Manchester United 6-3 in Premier League on Sunday. Manchester City have become only the third side in Premier League history to have two players score hat-tricks in a single match. With 20 points from eight matches, Manchester City are one point behind leaders Arsenal in the standings.

97.title: India's batting is doing well ahead of T20 WC: Aakash Chopra
97.article_body: Ex-cricketer Aakash Chopra said that looking at India's overall preparations for the upcoming T20 World Cup, the side's batting unit is doing well. "When Hardik Pandya comes in for Rishabh Pant, the batting will get stronger. Axar Patel is also scoring runs, so there are no worries," Chopra said. He added that there will be no dew in Australia.

98.title: No one can stop us: Rahul addresses rally amid heavy rains in K'taka
98.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi addressed a public rally in Karnataka's Mysuru during the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' amid heavy rains on Sunday. “In uniting India, no one can stop us. From raising...voice of India, no one can stop us. Will go from Kanniyakumari to Kashmir, no one can stop Bharat Jodo Yatra," Gandhi said. Congress shared a video from the rally.

99.title: CCTV video shows the moment terrorists opened fire at security forces in Pulwama
99.article_body: A CCTV video has emerged of the moment security forces came under attack from terrorists in the Pinglana area of J&K's Pulwama on Sunday. The attack led to the death of one policeman and injured a CRPF jawan. Terrorists opened fire at a checkpoint in the area, hours after a terrorist linked to Lashkar-e-Taiba was shot dead in Shopian.

100.title: Suryakumar Yadav breaks world record for taking fewest balls to reach 1,000 T20I runs
100.article_body: Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav has broken the world record for taking the fewest number of balls to reach 1,000 runs in T20I cricket, achieving the feat in the second T20I against South Africa on Sunday. The 32-year-old took 573 deliveries to reach the 1,000-run mark. He overtook Australia's Glenn Maxwell, who had taken 604 deliveries to reach the milestone.

101.title: Violence? On Gandhi Jayanti? Against South Africa? Jaffer as India score 237/3 in 2nd T20I
101.article_body: Reacting to India smashing a total of 237/3 in their 20 overs against South Africa, Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "Violence? On Gandhi Jayanti? Against South Africa?!" The total is India's highest against South Africa in T20I cricket and overall their fourth highest total in T20I cricket. India slammed 13 sixes in their innings.

102.title: UP restricts use of tractors as public transport after Kanpur accident
102.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Transport Department has issued an order restricting the use of tractors as public transport. The order stated that tractors and trolleys should be used for agriculture-related works and transportation of goods only. This comes a day after 26 people were killed when a tractor-trolley overturned and fell into a pond on Unnao-Kanpur road.

103.title: Man arrested for raping 18-year-old Dalit woman in UP's Ballia
103.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly raping an 18-year-old Dalit woman in a village in Ballia, UP. The victim alleged that the accused, Rahul Rajbhar (22), raped her after dragging her to a sugarcane field. Rajbhar allegedly made the video of the act and posted it on social media, police said.

104.title: After snake, floodlight failure halts India-South Africa T20I in Guwahati; pic surfaces
104.article_body: After the second India-South Africa T20I in Guwahati was stopped briefly due to a snake on the pitch during India's innings, the match was halted again after 2.1 overs of South Africa's innings due to floodlight failure. Pictures of one of the malfunctioning floodlights surfaced online. Several fans criticised the organisers over multiple delays in the match.

105.title: Anyone have issues with his strike rate now: Uthappa on Rahul's 57(28) vs SA
105.article_body: Reacting to India opener KL Rahul's 28-ball 57 in second T20I against South Africa, ex-India cricketer Robin Uthappa took to Twitter and wrote, "Anyone have issues with KL Rahul's strike rate now?" Rahul scored his 20th T20I half-century off 24 balls at a strike rate of 203.57. He hit five fours and four sixes during his knock in Guwahati.

106.title: When will we play with our strongest XI: Rajkumar on India ahead of T20 WC
106.article_body: Commenting on changes in Team India's playing XI ahead of T20 World Cup 2022, Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said, "My question is when will we play with our strongest XI?" He added, "We still don't know what our first-choice XI is keeping in mind all the injuries." The T20 World Cup will begin on October 16.

107.title: India record their highest-ever T20I total against South Africa
107.article_body: India on Sunday recorded their highest-ever T20I total against South Africa after registering 237/3 in their 20 overs in the second T20I in Guwahati. Suryakumar Yadav top-scored for India with 61 runs off 22 deliveries. India's previous highest T20I total against South Africa had come on June 9, 2022, when they recorded 211/4 in Delhi.

108.title: Chinese film 'Return to Dust' disappears from the country's cinemas, internet
108.article_body: Chinese film 'Return to Dust' has been withdrawn from cinemas and streaming platforms in the country despite earning 100 million yuan at the box office. Released in China on July 8, the film depicts the hardships of life in rural China. "We didn't receive an official document to block the film," a person associated with the film's makers said.

109.title: What are the new UAE Green Visa, Golden Visa rules effective from tomorrow?
109.article_body: As per new rules effective from October 3, UAE will allow tourists with valid visas to enter and stay for 60 days. The five-year Green Residence Visa will allow foreigners to sponsor themselves without reliance on employers, with a provision for getting residence permits for their families. Golden Visas will now remain valid irrespective of the time spent in UAE.

110.title: Working to protect 10,000 customers after Optus attack: Australian police
110.article_body: Australian police said they've begun operation to protect personal information of 10,000 people whose data may have been shared online after a cyber attack on Optus. This comes days after hackers released details of Optus' customers, saying they wouldn't stop posting details until they receive $1 million. Affected people may have had their 100-point identification compromised, police said.

111.title: Police official suspended after Moosewala murder accused escapes custody
111.article_body: Punjab Director General of Police (DGP) Gaurav Yadav on Sunday said that an FIR has been filed and an officer has been suspended after Sidhu Moosewala murder accused, Deepak Tinu escaped from police custody. Tinu managed to ditch CIA officials when he was being brought from Kapurthala Jail to Mansa on remand in a private vehicle Saturday night, officials said.

112.title: Rohit gets frustrated after umpire doesn't call wide, video of his reaction goes viral
112.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Team India captain Rohit Sharma getting frustrated after umpire didn't signal a leg-side wide in the second over during the second T20I against South Africa. The umpire thought that the ball touched Rohit's body before going to wicketkeeper, however, the replays confirmed no contact. Rohit then mockingly signalled DRS to show his disappointment.

113.title: Video of Virat Kohli giving pep talk to Team India goes viral, fans react
113.article_body: A video of former Team India captain Virat Kohli giving a pep talk to the team ahead of the second T20I against South Africa in Guwahati has gone viral. Reacting to the video, a fan tweeted, "Still a leader, King Kohli." Another wrote, "King doing the talking." "Virat masterclass," another tweet read.

114.title: Rajesh Khanna stopped talking after I contested election against him: Shatrughan
114.article_body: Actor-politician Shatrughan Sinha revealed late actor Rajesh Khanna had stopped talking to him after Shatrughan contested the election in Delhi against him. Shatrughan said he was set against Rajesh after LK Advani had to let go of his Delhi seat after winning in Gandhinagar. "I tried to sort things out. I...said sorry to him after a few years," he added.

115.title: 5G launch heralding new era of Digital India: Dr Kalam's tech advisor
115.article_body: SP Singh, ex-President Dr APJ Abdul Kalam's technology and policy advisor, said launch of 5G services in India "is truly heralding a new era of Digital India". 5G is expected to impact a wide array of industries, including agriculture, healthcare, education and governance, Singh said. Applications powered by 5G are expected to produce over $12 trillion by 2035, he added.

116.title: Apple may soon launch new classical music-streaming app: Report
116.article_body: Apple may soon launch a new music app, focused on classical recordings, alongside its existing Apple Music app, The Independent reported citing hidden code. Apple had announced the new app in August 2021, when it bought classical music streaming service Primephonic, and said it would arrive before 2022-end. It hasn't mentioned the new classical music-streaming app since the announcement.

117.title: Colonialism not dead: Uday Kotak's son on UK, India's borrowing rates
117.article_body: Jay Kotak, Kotak Mahindra Bank CEO and billionaire Uday Kotak's son, compared borrowing rates in the UK and India saying, "Colonialism isn't entirely dead!" "India borrows at 7.5% [while] the UK at 4% (10 year government bond). India has similar GDP, higher GDP growth & forex reserves, lower exchange rate depreciation, public debt and fiscal deficit to GDP!" he added.

118.title: PM Modi, Vice President Dhankhar attend prayer meet at Gandhi Smriti
118.article_body: PM Narendra Modi attended a prayer meeting organised on the occasion of Gandhi Jayanti at Gandhi Smriti in Delhi on Sunday. Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar was also present there. Earlier in the day, PM Modi also paid floral tributes to Mahatma Gandhi and former PM Lal Bahadur Shastri at Rajghat and Vijay Ghat respectively.

119.title: I'd like to bat with Jemimah: Anjum after India batter's match-winning 76
119.article_body: Praising India Women batter Jemimah Rodrigues following her match-winning knock against Sri Lanka in Women's Asia Cup, ex-India captain Anjum Chopra said, "I would like to bat with Jemimah." She added, "She is a busy player and always seems to be looking for that quick single. My game was based on the same theory." Jemimah top-scored with a 53-ball 76.

120.title: Hope the world takes note: Mahindra as Indore celebrates cleanest city award
120.article_body: Anand Mahindra shared a video of people celebrating as Indore bagged the cleanest city award for the sixth time in a row, calling it a "real mindset transformation". He said, "The world sees India as a country where we dance and celebrate on many occasions. I hope the world will notice this new occasion for celebration."

121.title: Was kicked out of 'Housefull 4', my credit was taken away: Sajid Khan
121.article_body: Filmmaker Sajid Khan, speaking about 'Housefull 4', said, "I was making 'Housefull 4' but got kicked out of the movie. My credit was taken away." "I felt like this was all the god's way of telling me that you've to become...nicer person," he added. Several women had accused Sajid of sexual misconduct during the #MeToo movement in 2018.

122.title: Not scared of such threats: Maha CM Shinde on threat to life report
122.article_body: Responding to a threat to life report, following which his security has been tightened, Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said that he wasn't scared of such threats. "I don't pay attention to it. Our Home Department and Home Minister Devendra Fadnavis are capable and we trust them," he said, adding that nobody can stop him from working for the public.

123.title: Snake enters field during India-South Africa T20I in Guwahati, video goes viral
123.article_body: The play during the second India-South Africa T20I in Guwahati was briefly halted after a snake entered the field. The snake was spotted after India's seventh over. Several groundsmen came on the field and escorted the snake away from the playing area after which the game resumed. "Never saw a snake stopping a cricket match," a fan tweeted.

124.title: If Ind's WC campaign is centred on winning toss, it's big worry: Chopra
124.article_body: Former cricketer Aakash Chopra said that it's a big worry if India's entire T20 World Cup campaign is centred on winning the toss. "They (India) failed to defend against Pakistan and Sri Lanka in the Asia Cup," Chopra said. He added, "But if they keep fielding first, they might suffer when the toss doesn't go their way."

125.title: Pic shows the car ex-PM Lal Bahadur Shastri bought after taking a ₹5,000 loan
125.article_body: Former PM Lal Bahadur Shastri's grandson Vibhakar Shastri took to Twitter to share a picture of the car that belonged to the former PM. "Shastri Ji took a loan of ₹5,000 from the bank to buy this car...After his death, the loan was repaid by Smt. Lalita Shastri," he tweeted. Sunday marked the 118th birth anniversary of the former PM.

126.title: ONDC floats consultation paper for public to comment on 24 issues
126.article_body: The Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC) has floated a consultation paper to seek comments of the public on 24 issues relating to payments, fulfilment of orders, refunds and cancellations. ONDC is hoping to democratise the e-commerce segment in India and is seeking to build trust among the participants. The ONDC called it an "open consultation".

127.title: Airox Technologies aims to raise ₹750 cr IPO, files papers with SEBI
127.article_body: Medical oxygen supplier Airox Technologies has filed its draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with SEBI to raise ₹750 crore via an initial public offering (IPO). The IPO will entirely be an offer-for-sale (OFS) by shareholders Sanjay Bharatkumar Jaiswal and Ashima Sanjay Jaiswal. Sanjay and Ashima intend to sell shares worth ₹525 crore and ₹225 crore respectively.

128.title: His condition is stable: SP after Mulayam Singh admitted to ICU
128.article_body: Former Uttar Pradesh CM and Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav's condition is stable, the party said in a statement on Sunday. He was shifted to the intensive care unit (ICU) of Medanta Hospital in Gurugram earlier in the day. The Samajwadi Party said the 82-year-old leader is being treated under the supervision of senior doctors.

129.title: SEBI tightens disclosure norms for IPO-bound companies
129.article_body: SEBI approved new mandates including tightening of disclosure norms for IPO-bound companies. In its board meeting, the market regulator allowed companies for confidential pre-filing of offer documents along with relaxing open offer pricing rules for disinvestment of public sector undertakings (PSUs). As per the new norms, buying and selling of mutual funds falls under insider trading rules.

130.title: Windfall profit tax cut on domestic crude oil, diesel; scrapped for jet fuel
130.article_body: According to a Finance Ministry notification issued late Saturday night, the tax on domestically produced crude oil was reduced from ₹10,500 to ₹8,000 per tonne. The levy on the diesel export was reduced to ₹5 per litre from ₹10 per litre. The government also scrapped the export tax on jet fuel completely. All the changes will be effective immediately.

131.title: Karthi pens note after 'Ponniyin Selvan' collects ₹150 cr worldwide
131.article_body: Actor Karthi, who played Vallavaraiyan Vanthiyathevan in 'Ponniyin Selvan: I', took to Twitter and penned a note for his fans. "Words cannot express the immense gratitude I feel for this experience and magnificent journey as Vanthiyethevan...It's overwhelming to receive all your love," Karthi wrote. This comes after his film crossed ₹150 crore gross worldwide as per Trade analyst Ramesh Bala.

132.title: Kohli needed break to re-energise his battery: Shane Watson
132.article_body: Ex-Australian cricketer Shane Watson said that Indian batter Virat Kohli needed "some time off to re-energise his battery". "I could see from even far, during the last IPL, you could see his energy was low. He was trying to get his best," Watson said. He added, "He is at the peak of his powers...Great to see him at his best."

133.title: DPIIT to seek Cabinet nod for bill to decriminalise minor offences: Official
133.article_body: According to an official, the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT) will soon seek the Cabinet's approval for The Ease of Doing Business and Ease of Living (Amendment of Provisions) Bill, 2022. The bill aims to decriminalise minor offences by rationalising about 110 provisions across 35 Acts under different ministries to ensure ease of doing business.

134.title: Rohit Sharma becomes first Indian to play 400 matches in T20 cricket history
134.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma has become the first-ever Indian cricketer to feature in 400 matches in T20 cricket history. India's second T20I against South Africa in Guwahati marks Rohit's 400th T20 match. West Indian all-rounder Kieron Pollard holds the record of playing the most number of T20 matches (614).

135.title: Ethiopia's 23-yr-old Yehualaw becomes youngest-ever winner of London marathon
135.article_body: Ethiopia's 23-year-old Yalemzerf Yehualaw became the youngest-ever winner of the London marathon, finishing in two hours, 17 minutes and 26 seconds. Notably, it's the third fastest women's London Marathon time in history. Yehualaw, who tripped during the run, said she's happy to win in London. Kenya's Amos Kipruto won the men's race in two hours, four minutes and 39 seconds.

136.title: 50-year-old man's body recovered from well in Rajasthan
136.article_body: The body of a 50-year-old man was recovered from a well at his farm in Haipura village in Rajasthan's Jhalawar district. The feet of the deceased, Hemraj Lodha, were tied with a towel, police said. There was a dispute between Hemraj and his two nephews, Vinod (33) and Mohan (22), over some portion of land, police added.

137.title: NASA finds mystery object stuck to Mars Helicopter's foot during latest flight
137.article_body: NASA said it noticed a mysterious object stuck to the foot of the Ingenuity Mars Helicopter during its latest flight on the red planet. "There's something on your foot, Mars Helicopter! We're looking into a bit of debris that ended up on Ingenuity's foot," said NASA while sharing visuals of the debris. The object didn't impact its flight, NASA said.

138.title: Muslims won't say 'Vande Mataram': SP's Abu Azmi on Maha govt's GR
138.article_body: SP leader Abu Azmi on Sunday said that Muslims won't say 'Vande Mataram' instead of 'hello' while addressing public or government officials and making announcements. His response came following the Maharashtra government's Government Resolution, directing government employees to greet with 'Vande Mataram' instead of 'hello'. Eknath Shinde has come under the pressure of BJP and RSS, Azmi added.

139.title: Officials warn of threat to Maharashtra CM Shinde's life; security tightened
139.article_body: The State Intelligence Department (SID) has received specific input about the threat to the life of Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde, following which his security has been tightened further, an official said on Sunday. Shinde already has a 'Z Plus' category security cover. Security has also been increased at Shinde's private residence in Thane and the official residence 'Varsha' in Mumbai.

140.title: Electric scooter battery explosion kills 7-year-old boy near Mumbai
140.article_body: A seven-year-old child was killed after the battery of an electric scooter exploded after overnight charging near Mumbai, police said. The incident took place on September 23 when the deceased's father had kept the battery on charge around 2:30 am before the sound of an explosion woke him up around 5:30 am. The deceased succumbed to injuries on September 30.

141.title: 35-year-old woman dies after being burnt alive by husband in Thane
141.article_body: A 35-year-old woman, who was allegedly burnt alive by her husband in Thane, died while undergoing treatment. The accused, who was having an affair, hatched a plan to get rid of his wife and two daughters (who are undergoing treatment) by burning them alive and making it look like an accident. The accused also got injured in the incident.

142.title: Jio to launch 4G-enabled laptop for ₹15,000: Report
142.article_body: Reliance Jio will be launching a laptop with an embedded 4G sim card for ₹15,000, Reuters reported on Sunday. The company has partnered with companies like Qualcomm and Microsoft for the 'JioBook'. The laptop will be available to enterprise customers like schools and government institutes from this month, with a consumer launch expected within the next three months.

143.title: FPIs withdraw ₹7,624 cr in Sept, turn net sellers after 2 months
143.article_body: After remaining net buyers in the last two months, foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) have turned net sellers again in September and withdrawn ₹7,624 crore from Indian equity markets. Data with depositories showed that total outflow from Indian equity markets by FPIs has reached ₹1.68 lakh crore so far in 2022. FPIs had invested ₹51,200 crore in August.

144.title: India announce their playing XI for 2nd T20I against South Africa
144.article_body: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma won the toss and elected to bowl first in the second T20I against India in Guwahati. India are fielding the same side that played in the first T20I. Meanwhile, South Africa have made one change to their playing XI, with Lungi Ngidi replacing Tabraiz Shamsi.

145.title: Indian women's team registers 1st win in Group 5 at World Team TT C'ships
145.article_body: Indian women's table tennis team defeated the Czech Republic 3-0 to register their first win in Group 5 at ITTF World Team Championships Finals 2022 in China on Sunday. Manika Batra and Diya Chitale won their respective matches 3-1, while Sreeja Akula won 3-0. India are currently second in the group standings. India lost to Germany in their first match.

146.title: Hyd Police foils conspiracy to kill BJP-RSS leaders, 3 held
146.article_body: The Commissioner's Taskforce, along with the state intelligence department on Sunday, foiled an attempt to assassinate BJP and RSS leaders by detaining a few suspects from Hyderabad's Malakpet area. The accused hatched the conspiracy at the behest of foreign handlers based in Pakistan, police said, adding that they got explosives to carry out the plan.

147.title: Leaders like Kharge can't bring change: Tharoor amid Cong Prez polls
147.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Sunday said that leaders like Mallikarjun Kharge can't bring change and will continue the existing system. "We aren't enemies, it's not war. It's a poll for our party's future. Kharge ji comes in the top three leaders of Congress," he said. I will bring change as per party workers' expectations, Tharoor said.

148.title: 13 firms sign non-disclosure agreement with govt to use ULIP data
148.article_body: As many as 13 firms have signed a non-disclosure agreement with the government to access data from the Unified Logistics Interface Platform (ULIP), the Commerce and Industry Ministry said on Saturday. The 13 firms include MapmyIndia and Yes Bank. It added that 11 more organisations, including Bosch India, Portlinks and Shiprocket, are in the process of signing the agreement.

149.title: India squad for ODI series against South Africa announced
149.article_body: The BCCI on Sunday announced Team India squad for the upcoming ODI series against South Africa. Shikhar Dhawan has been named the captain of the squad, while Shreyas Iyer will be his deputy. Batter Rajat Patidar and fast bowler Mukesh Kumar have received their maiden Team India call-ups. The squad also includes Mohammed Siraj, Avesh Khan and Shahbaz Ahmed.

150.title: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav reaches Gurugram hospital where Mulayam is admitted
150.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Sunday reached Medanta Hospital in Gurugram where his father and SP founder Mulayam Singh Yadav has been admitted. Mulayam has been shifted to the intensive care unit at the hospital. The 82-year-old has been undergoing treatment for the last few weeks. UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya wished him a speedy recovery.

151.title: Truly blessed, humbled: 'Tanhaji' director on winning 3 National Awards
151.article_body: Filmmaker Om Raut took to Instagram after his film 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' won three National Awards. "I'm truly blessed...humbled and will use this honour, that's bestowed upon me, as a symbol to try harder to entertain everyone for years to come," he wrote. The film won a National Award for Best Popular Film, Best Costume Design and Best Actor.

152.title: We were going to end 'Brahmāstra 1' with Dev's face reveal: Ayan
152.article_body: Director Ayan Mukerji said they were going to end 'Brahmāstra: Part One' with Dev's face reveal. "It was with a lot of thought...to create some curiosity in the minds of the audiences that we ended the film where we did," Ayan added. Ayan said Dev could be the "most exciting character" he will be taking on in his career.

153.title: Heroin worth ₹34 cr concealed in trolley bag seized at Mumbai airport
153.article_body: Around five kilograms of heroin, worth ₹34 crore, which was concealed in a cavity inside a trolley bag, was seized by the Customs department at the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport on Sunday. A passenger has been held by the officials. In another incident, a woman was held with cocaine worth ₹4.9 crore at the Mumbai airport.

154.title: Increased repo rate big dampener for us: Automobile industry body
154.article_body: Federation of Automobile Dealers Associations (FADA) President MR Singhania said hike in repo rate is a "big dampener" for the automobile industry, particularly for price-sensitive entry-level two-wheelers and passenger vehicles segments. RBI on Friday raised repo rate by 50 bps, the fourth straight increase since May 2022. Manufacturers of two-wheelers hiked prices five times in 2021, he added.

155.title: AAP to form govt in Gujarat, says Kejriwal; cites 'IB report'
155.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, while citing an "Intelligence Bureau report", said that AAP will form the government in Gujarat if elections are held on Sunday. However, he claimed that his party will form the government in Gujarat with a very thin margin and urged the people of the state to give a "big push" to AAP.

156.title: OPEC+ to consider oil output cut of over 1 million barrels per day: Reports
156.article_body: According to reports, OPEC+ is mulling an oil output cut of over a million barrels per day when it meets on October 5. OPEC+, consisting of OPEC countries and allies like Russia, will meet in person in Vienna for the first time since March 2020. The output cuts are being considered after the fall in global oil rates.

157.title: 198-kg meth, 9-kg cocaine worth ₹1,476 crore seized in Navi Mumbai
157.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) seized 198 kg of methamphetamine and 9 kg of cocaine, totalling ₹1,476 crore in Navi Mumbai. The department said the consignment belonged to drug cartels in South Africa, and India was being used as a transit country. "They conceal drugs in the boxes of Valencia oranges imported from South Africa," said an official.

158.title: Rosy breaks 8-yr-old women's pole vault national record at 36th National Games
158.article_body: Rosy Meena Paulraj of Tamil Nadu won a gold medal after setting a new national record of 4.20m in the women's pole vault event at 36th National Games on Saturday. The 25-year-old broke the previous mark of 4.15m set by VS Surekha in 2014. Surekha set the record in New Delhi. The 36th National Games are being held in Gujarat.

159.title: He is more than just an off-spinner: Eng's Ben Duckett on Ashwin
159.article_body: English batter Ben Duckett said that India's Ravichandran Ashwin is "more than just an off-spinner". "He (Ashwin) spins it both ways. He is incredible. I was lucky to play with him when he played for Nottinghamshire and I was facing him in the nets every time I could," Duckett said. He added, "If I face Ashwin in India...it would...[be] hard.''

160.title: Gujarat Giants' Chris Gayle dances with Kalbeliya artistes, video goes viral
160.article_body: Chris Gayle, who is playing for Gujarat Giants in the Legends League Cricket, danced with Kalbeliya artistes to celebrate Navratri. A video of the same has gone viral on social media. Gujarat Giants shared the video, writing, "The Universe Boss @chrisgayle333 dancing on the dhol beats to celebrate Navratri!" Gayle has scored 83 runs in the tournament so far.

161.title: Looking for duel with ex-teammate Mitchell Johnson in LLC 2022: Lee
161.article_body: Ex-Australian pacer Brett Lee said that it would be fun to play alongside former Indian spinner Harbhajan Singh in the Legends League Cricket 2022, where Lee has recently joined the Manipal Tigers team. "I am looking for a duel with my old teammate Mitchell Johnson...After checking in, I had a nice interaction with Chris Gayle," Lee said.

162.title: Twitter posts the first-ever edited tweet
162.article_body: Twitter has sent out the first-ever edited tweet that is publicly visible, showing users how the tweets will look when the feature is rolled out. The tweet about testing the feature was posted by Twitter Blue, the official account of Twitter's monthly subscription service. Edited tweets appear with an icon, timestamp, and label to show the original tweet was modified.

163.title: I support BJP: Auto driver who invited AAP's Kejriwal for dinner in Ahmedabad
163.article_body: Auto-rickshaw driver Vikram Dantani, who invited Delhi CM and AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal to his house for dinner in Gujarat's Ahmedabad last month, said that he has always been a BJP supporter. He attended PM Narendra Modi's rally in Gujarat on Friday. "I invited Kejriwal for dinner because I was asked to do so by auto union leaders," Dantani said.

164.title: Government issues draft guidelines for listing of regional rural banks
164.article_body: The Finance Ministry issued draft guidelines to enable regional rural banks (RRBs) to raise resources by listing on stock exchanges. According to the guidelines, RBRs would require a net worth of at least ₹300 crore during the previous three years. They should also possess capital adequacy above the regulatory minimum level of 9% in each of the previous three years.

165.title: Ex-UP CM & Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav shifted to ICU at Gurugram hospital
165.article_body: Former Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister and Samajwadi Party leader Mulayam Singh Yadav has been shifted to the intensive care unit (ICU) at the Medanta Hospital in Gurugram. The 82-year-old has been undergoing treatment for the last few weeks. His son and SP chief Akhilesh Yadav is reportedly on his way to Delhi.

166.title: Saif, Hrithik are just outstanding in 'Vikram Vedha': Kareena Kapoor
166.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan reviewed her husband and actor Saif Ali Khan's film 'Vikram Vedha' and said that the film is "absolutely fantastic". "The storytelling, the performances, just everything about the movie (was fantastic)...Saif and Hrithik are just outstanding in the film," she added. Kareena stated she loves watching "commercial, blockbuster" kinds of films.

167.title: Playing 5 games before Super 12 in T20 WC will be to SL's advantage: Shanaka
167.article_body: Ahead of T20 World Cup, Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said the five matches which his side is going to play in Australia will be to their advantage because they can read the conditions and wickets going into Super 12 stage. SL haven't directly qualified for Super 12. They'll play two warm-up matches and three matches in the group stage.

168.title: Indian men's team beat 2nd seeds Germany at World Team TT Championships
168.article_body: Indian men's table tennis team beat second seeds Germany 3-1 in their second group stage match at ITTF World Team Championships Finals 2022 in China on Sunday. Sathiyan Gnanasekaran won both his matches. Harmeet Desai lost his singles match, while Manav Thakkar won. India are currently third in Group 2 standings. India will face Kazakhstan in their third match.

169.title: 97% mobiles used in India now are Made-in-India against 10% in 2014: Minister
169.article_body: Minister of State for Electronics and IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said around 97% of the smartphones sold in India today are domestically produced as against 90% imports in 2014. State governments should proactively participate in Centre's projects to generate investment and employment in sectors like electronics, he said. "We'll make the internet open, safe, trusted and accountable," he added.

170.title: 4 of family, including 2 children, killed in road accident in MP
170.article_body: Four members of a family were killed and another person was injured after a truck rammed into their car near Berkhedi village in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district. The deceased, Mohit Shukla (38), his wife Raksha (36) and their two daughters, aged 11 and 7 years, were returning from Kanpur, UP. The accused truck driver has been arrested, police said.

171.title: Inflation will average 5.2% next fiscal, assuming normal rains: RB
171.article_body: According to RBI's 'Monetary Policy Report September 2022', average inflation will be 5.2% in 2023-24, assuming "a normal monsoon, a progressive normalisation of supply chains, and no further exogenous or policy shocks". The central bank is mandated to keep retail inflation in a range of 2-6%. The RBI recently hiked the repo rate to 5.9% to bring inflation under control.

172.title: BJP has dozens who are on bail: Shivakumar on Bommai's 'fake Gandhis' remark
172.article_body: Reacting to Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai’s ‘fake Gandhis’ comment, Congress leader DK Shivakumar said that BJP has dozens who are on bail. "Yes, I'm on bail. Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi are also on bail...Yediyurappa has no case against him? Bommai registered cases against me. Let him send me to Parappana Agrahara (Central Jail)," he said.

173.title: Insolvency cases involving nearly ₹10.5 lakh cr disposed of in 5 yrs: NCLT
173.article_body: National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has disposed of insolvency cases amounting to nearly ₹10.5 lakh crore in last five years, said NCLT President Chief Justice (Retired) Ramalingam Sudhakar. Of the total, 23,608 cases amounting to ₹7.21 lakh crore have been settled before admission. Resolution plans have been approved in 565 cases, involving an amount of ₹3.03 lakh crore, Sudhakar added.

174.title: Will wear PayCM t-shirt, let's see what BJP will do: DK Shivakumar
174.article_body: The Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar dared the government to take action against him for wearing the PayCM t-shirt, alleging that several party workers were booked for wearing the same t-shirt. "Congress leaders will participate in the Bharat Jodo Yatra by wearing PayCM t-shirts. Let’s see what the BJP will do...We are not afraid of this (cases)," said Shivakumar.

175.title: As PM Modi desires, India will take lead in 6G: Ashwini Vaishnaw
175.article_body: Union Telecom Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Sunday said India will take a lead in 6G as it's PM Narendra Modi’s desire to take a "global lead in 6G". His statement came a day after PM Modi launched 5G services in selected cities. Meanwhile, Union Minister of State for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said 5G technology will transform life of every Indian.

176.title: Traffic on Mumbai-B'luru highway resumes after old Pune bridge razed
