176.article_body: Traffic resumed on the Mumbai-Bengaluru highway near Chandani Chowk in Pune on Sunday morning after debris created by the demolition of the old bridge was cleared. The traffic was diverted since last night. The Chandani Chowk bridge in Pune was demolished using 600 kg of emulsion explosives as it was causing a traffic bottleneck.

177.title: Delhi teacher stabs wife in front of 9-yr-old daughter after an argument
177.article_body: A government school teacher stabbed his wife in front of their nine-year-old daughter in Delhi. The woman died after sustaining serious injuries. The man stabbed the woman following an argument. The daughter told the police that her father stabbed her mother using a knife. When police reached the spot, the woman was found dead and the man was missing.

178.title: It'll be tough call between Shami, Chahar in Bumrah's absence: Aakash
178.article_body: Amid uncertainty over Jasprit Bumrah's participation in the upcoming T20 WC, commentator Aakash Chopra has said India should've picked five pacers in their squad for the tournament. "If Bumrah is not available, then India will have to make a tough call between Mohammad Shami and Deepak Chahar," he added. Shami and Chahar both are among standby players for the WC.

179.title: Fake call centre cheating US citizens busted in Thane, 16 arrested
179.article_body: Thane Police raided a fake call centre and arrested 16 people reportedly involved in cheating US citizens on the pretext of providing loans. "After obtaining their bank account details, the accused would siphon off funds from their accounts," said the police. An agent coordinating in the US would collect the money and transfer it to India through 'hawala'.

180.title: Senior Assam police official shares pic with Rohit Sharma, says 'A century is must'
180.article_body: Senior Assam police official Ponjit Dowarah took to his Twitter account to share a picture of himself with Team India captain Rohit Sharma. He wrote, "Best of luck. Ek century ban ta hein (A century is must)." This comes ahead of India's second T20I against South Africa, which will take place in Guwahati tonight.

181.title: PCB should ask Babar Azam if captaincy is taking a toll on him: Miandad
181.article_body: Ex-Pakistan batter Javed Miandad has said that PCB should have an "honest" conversation with Babar Azam and ask him if captaincy is taking a toll on him. "If Babar feels he can't perform [both]...then the captaincy shouldn't stay with him," added Miandad. Notably, Babar has scored a century and a fifty in the ongoing seven-match T20I series against England.

182.title: Difficult for those in power to walk in Gandhiji's footsteps: Rahul
182.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on the occasion of Mahatma Gandhi's 153rd birth anniversary on Sunday said, "[It's] convenient for those in power to appropriate Gandhiji's legacy but difficult to walk in his footsteps." He added that amid politics of violence and lies, Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra will "spread message of ahimsa and swaraj".

183.title: Builder, 8 others booked for embezzling ₹15 crore in Gurugram
183.article_body: A builder and eight others have been booked for allegedly embezzling ₹15 crore from 20 people by offering to sell them shops-cum-offices (SCO) at a township in Farrukhnagar in Gurugram's Sector 3. The complainants alleged that despite taking initial payments from 28 individuals for SCOs, the accused did not obtain the Department of Town and Country Planning license, police said.

184.title: Govt extends concessional customs duty on edible oil import till March 2023
184.article_body: The Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) has extended existing concessional import duties on specified edible oils up to March 31, 2023. The government, in its notification, said that the move was aimed at increasing domestic supply and keeping prices under control. The concessional customs duty on edible oil import was also extended till March 2023.

185.title: Suspected Chinese hackers attacked Canadian chat programme: Report
185.article_body: Suspected Chinese hackers tampered with a widely used software distributed by a Canada-based customer service company Comm100, cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike said in a blog post. CrowdStrike executive Adam Meyers said hackers were suspected to be Chinese because of their behaviour patterns and language in the code. Chinese government has rejected the claim, accusing the US of spreading lies.

186.title: Bommai calls Sonia & Rahul 'fake Gandhis', says Congress out on bail
186.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai called Congress leaders Sonia and Rahul "fake Gandhis" and said that the whole Congress party is out on bail. "Today is Gandhi Jayanti. Why should I talk about fake Gandhis? Rahul Gandhi, Sonia Gandhi and DK Shivakumar are out on bail," he said. Bommai further added that Karnataka was an ATM for the Congress party.

187.title: US, Australia, Japan express concern over China at trilateral meet
187.article_body: US, Australia and Japan's defence ministers held a trilateral meeting in Hawaii on Saturday. "We're deeply concerned by China's...bullying behaviour in...Taiwan Strait, and elsewhere in the region," US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin said in his opening remarks. Moreover, Australian Defence Minister Richard Marles said that China is trying to "shape the world...in a way that we've not seen before."

188.title: Raj MLAs got agitated over name of 'new CM': Gehlot on Raj political crisis
188.article_body: While addressing the political crisis in the state, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that the MLAs got agitated when Sachin Pilot's name was raised to succeed him as the CM of the state. "When a CM is changed, 80-90% (MLAs) leave him and switch sides. They turn to the new candidate. I too don't consider it wrong," he said.

189.title: Dan Wieden, the man behind Nike's 'Just Do It' slogan, passes away at 77
189.article_body: Dan Wieden, the Co-founder of the US-based advertising agency 'Wieden+Kennedy' who coined Nike's 'Just Do It' slogan, passed away at the age of 77 on Friday. The agency, co-founded by Wieden with late David Kennedy, has created campaigns for big companies like McDonald's, Samsung, Old Spice and others. "We will miss you so much," the company's Twitter account said.

190.title: Kolkata prison inmates to get mutton, paneer, dum aloo in special Pujo meals
190.article_body: All 2,500 prisoners at Presidency Central Correctional Home in south Kolkata will get special Durga Pujo meals for four days from October 2 to October 5. An official said that the inmates will get dum aloo, paneer masala, mutton biryani, fried rice and chilli chicken as part of different meals. Rasgullas and laddus will also be served.

191.title: Kareena Kapoor & Saif Ali Khan buy new Mercedes car worth ₹2 crore; pics surface
191.article_body: Kareena Kapoor and Saif Ali Khan have purchased a Mercedes-Benz S 350d worth ₹2 crore. In visuals that surfaced on social media, Kareena could be seen holding her son Jeh as she unveiled the new car at her residence. Recently, the couple also bought a Jeep Wrangler Rubicon, which costs around ₹60 lakh.

192.title: Arbaaz & I are happier, calmer people after divorce: Malaika Arora
192.article_body: Malaika Arora has said that she has a "much better relationship" with her ex-husband and actor Arbaaz Khan. "We're just happier, calmer people. He's (Arbaaz) a wonderful man, I only wish him the best in life," she stated. Malaika added that she is happy she made these decisions. "For women out there...Don't be afraid to follow your heart," Malaika stated.

193.title: Russia blocks SoundCloud for spreading 'false information'
193.article_body: Russia has restricted access to music-streaming app SoundCloud for spreading "false information" about what Moscow calls a "special military operation" in Ukraine, Interfax reported citing communications watchdog Roskomnadzor. The information was related to Russia's methods of warfare, including "attacks on civilians, strikes on civilian infrastructure", used in the "special operation", it added.

194.title: Gourav Vallabh, Deepender Hooda, Syed Hussain resign as Cong spokespersons
194.article_body: Congress leaders Gourav Vallabh, Deepender S Hooda and Syed Naseer Hussain on Saturday resigned from the post of official spokesperson of the party. Vallabh said that this has been done to campaign for the election of Mallikarjun Kharge as party President. "[We] want this election to be free and fair," Vallabh said.

195.title: Policeman martyred, CRPF personnel injured in terror attack in J&K's Pulwama
195.article_body: A police personnel was martyred and a CRPF personnel was injured as terrorists opened fire on a checkpost in Pulwama in Jammu and Kashmir on Sunday. Kashmir Zone Police said that a reinforcement was sent and the area is being cordoned off. This comes hours after a terrorist, linked to LeT, was shot dead in an encounter in Shopian.

196.title: Entered Congress Presidential polls to strengthen party: Kharge
196.article_body: Congress Presidential polls candidate Mallikarjun Kharge on Sunday said that he has not entered the party's Presidential polls to oppose anyone but to strengthen the party. Kharge added that in line with 'one person, one post' principle of the party, he resigned as the Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha on the day he filed the nomination.

197.title: Ready to face punishment if guilty in Ankita's murder case: Revenue official
197.article_body: Uttarakhand Revenue Sub-Inspector Vaibhav Pratap Singh, who was suspended for his suspicious role in Vanantara resort receptionist Ankita Bhandari's murder case, has denied the allegations levelled against him and said he is "ready to face any punishment" if found guilty. Singh further said that he didn't file the missing FIR immediately since he didn't have Ankita's family contact information.

198.title: WazirX lays off 40% employees, says 'Reduced staff to weather crypto winter'
198.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange WazirX has responded to reports claiming that the startup has laid off 40% of its employees. "Our priority is to be financially stable...To achieve this, we have had to reduce our staff to weather the crypto winter," the company said. Earlier, CoinDesk said WazirX laid off 50-70 employees and told them they would be paid for 45 days.

199.title: Plastic water bottle thrown at Arvind Kejriwal at garba event in Gujarat
199.article_body: A plastic water bottle was thrown at Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal during a garba event in Gujarat's Rajkot. AAP leaders said the bottle did not hit him and passed over his head. Kejriwal was accompanied by security officials and senior party leaders at the event. The Aam Aadmi Party said there was no need to approach the police.

200.title: BSNL could launch 5G services by August 2023: Ashwini Vaishnaw
200.article_body: Telecom operator Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) could launch 5G services on its network by August 2023, Union Telecom Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said on Saturday. "BSNL should start rolling out 5G by August of next year. That way, we'll have a good three private player-one public sector player ecosystem," Vaishnaw said. "India would remain an affordable [5G] market," he added.

201.title: Mughals, the British presence are also our history: Sobhita Dhulipala
201.article_body: 'Ponniyin Selvan' actress Sobhita Dhulipala responded to a question about making a film on "our history". Sobhita said the British presence in India, the Mughal rule and the Cholas or the Pallavas are "our history". "India constantly has had a foreign presence...a constant shift in the rulers...it's difficult to draw a line between what is ours...what isn't," she added.

202.title: I love seeing KL Rahul bat when he feels like he has nothing to lose: Watson
202.article_body: Ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has termed India's KL Rahul as one of his favourite batters who "takes the game on" and is not always trying to "control the game". Referring to talks over the batter's strike rate in recent matches, Watson said, "When Rahul feels like he's got nothing to lose, then he can even strike at 180."

203.title: Delhi govt to connect all unauthorised colonies with sewer system
203.article_body: The Delhi government will connect all unauthorised colonies and villages with sewer system to prevent effluents from flowing into the Yamuna and polluting it. Deputy CM Manish Sisodia approved various Delhi Jal Board projects on these lines, an official statement said. Delhi government will conduct a study on newly constructed lakes to assess the groundwater flow, the statement added.

204.title: Militants shoot dead Pakistani UN peacekeeper in Congo
204.article_body: A Pakistani soldier working as a UN peacekeeper was shot dead in a militant attack at a permanent operation base of the UN in Congo's Minembwe, Pakistan's military said in a statement. A group of six militants arrived at the base to apparently surrender their weapons, however, the group's leader started firing indiscriminately, according to the statement.

205.title: Teacher consumes alcohol during class in UP school, video showing beer cans surfaces
205.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a teacher sitting in the classroom while being allegedly drunk in Uttar Pradesh's Hathras. In the video, students can be seen sitting on the floor, with the teacher being caught with two beer cans. As per District Information Office, Hathras, the teacher has been suspended.

206.title: 4 women labourers washed away while crossing a submerged bridge in K'taka
206.article_body: Four women labourers were washed away in a stream while crossing a submerged bridge on their way home from work in the Koppal district of Karnataka on Saturday. The victims were aged 22, 28, 32 and 40 years. Two other women who were accompanying them managed to hold tree roots near the banks and were rescued by locals.

207.title: Happy to be back with team I love the most: India Women batter Jemimah
207.article_body: India Women batter Jemimah Rodrigues, who was adjudged 'Player of the Match' in her first match in Women's Asia Cup after an injury, said, "More than anything I was just happy to be back...with the team I love the most." The 22-year-old has recovered from a wrist injury that had ruled her out of the recent England series.

208.title: Rahul pays tribute to Mahatma, says Bapu taught us to walk on path of truth
208.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi paid floral tribute to Mahatma Gandhi on his 153rd birth anniversary. He took to Twitter and said, "Bapu taught us to walk on the path of truth and non-violence...Today on Gandhi Jayanti, we take a pledge, just as he united the country against injustice, we will now unite our India."

209.title: India's cleanest city Indore earns crores by processing 1,900 tonnes of waste daily
209.article_body: Indore, which has been named India's cleanest city for the sixth straight time by the government, processes 1,900 tonnes of urban waste every day which earns it crores of rupees, according to officials. The bio-CNG generated from the waste also helps in running the buses in the city. As many as 850 vehicles collect waste from households and business establishments.

210.title: Twitter banned 57,643 accounts from Jul 26-Aug 25 for child sexual exploitation
210.article_body: Twitter on Saturday said it banned 57,643 accounts in India between July 26 and August 25 for promoting child sexual exploitation, non-consensual nudity and allied content. Twitter added that it received 1,088 complaints from its users in the same time period and took action against 41 URLs. "We processed 76 grievances which were appealing Twitter account suspensions," Twitter added.

211.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra a battle with ideology which killed Mahatma Gandhi: Rahul
211.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said that 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is a battle with the ideology which killed Mahatma Gandhi. Gandhi said that BJP's politics is based on 'himsa and asatya' (violence and falsehood), adding that the yatra "will spread the message of ahimsa and swaraj (non-violence and self-governance)."

212.title: We're not playing against Haaland, we're playing vs Man City: Man Utd's Ten Hag
212.article_body: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag has said their focus will not be entirely on Norwegian striker Erling Haaland when they face Manchester City in their Premier League match on Sunday. "We're not playing against Haaland, we're playing against Manchester City," stated Ten Hag. Haaland has scored 11 goals in seven EPL games this season so far.

213.title: Sought a ban many times: Prof whose hand was chopped off by PFI men in Kerala
213.article_body: Professor TJ Joseph, whose hand was chopped off by PFI activists, stated that he sought a ban on the organisation several times. "There's no doubt that this is a terrorist organisation that kills, terrorises, that aims to establish an Islamic reign," he said. Joseph's right palm was chopped off by PFI men 12 years back for alleged blasphemy.

214.title: 15-year-old domestic worker dies of electrocution in Gurugram
214.article_body: A 15-year-old girl hired as a domestic worker at a Palam Vihar residence in Gurugram allegedly died of electrocution from a live wire. Based on a complaint filed by the deceased's elder sister, the house owner has been booked under IPC Section 302 (murder). Notably, the wire's covering was damaged, causing the metal gate to get electrified, police said.

215.title: SMEs raised ₹1,460 crore via 87 IPOs from January-September 2022
215.article_body: Small and medium enterprises (SMEs) have raised ₹1,460 crore through 87 initial public offerings (IPOs) between January and September 2022. The amount raised is 86.4% higher than the ₹783 crore that 56 SMEs raised in 2021, industry data showed. Of the 29 SME IPOs that have been launched in September 2022 alone, 25 have been concluded while four are ongoing.

216.title: 600 kg emulsion explosives used to demolish Pune's Chandani Chowk bridge
216.article_body: The Chandani Chowk bridge in Pune was demolished using 600 kg of emulsion explosives. About 350 people were part of the demolition drive and 15 JCBs, 10 forkland machines and 30 heavy trucks were employed to remove the debris after the demolition. This bridge was causing traffic on the busy national highway connecting Mumbai and Bengaluru.

217.title: Fresh round of allotment for Hyd's Rajiv Swagruha flats as allottees back out
217.article_body: The Telangana government has decided to allot the leftover Rajiv Swagruha flats in two townships (Bandlaguda and Pocharam) through a fresh round of lottery draw. The flats will be allotted to those who have already applied by paying ₹1,000 application fee, officials said. The move comes after many applicants who were allotted flats earlier did not proceed with the purchase.

218.title: 6-yr-old killed in 'human sacrifice' at under-construction CRPF HQ in Delhi
218.article_body: Two men allegedly killed a six-year-old as "human sacrifice" by slitting his throat in Delhi's Lodhi Colony, police said. The incident took place at the under-construction Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) headquarters. The accused stated that he saw 'Bhole Baba', who wanted him to slit the child's throat, said DCP (south) Chandan Chowdhary.

219.title: Conspiracy by enemies: Taliban as 35 die in Kabul suicide blast
219.article_body: Taliban government's Foreign Affairs Ministry has stated that the attacks carried out on mosques, educational centres and other public places are "a conspiracy by the enemies of the Afghan people". This comes as the death toll in the suicide blast at an education centre in Kabul rose to at least 35, according to United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan (UNAMA).

220.title: Someone told Kareena I'll only do TV now when I did 'Sacred...': Saif
220.article_body: Saif Ali Khan revealed someone had told his wife Kareena Kapoor that Saif will only do TV after he had accepted to be a part of 'Sacred Games'. "That's when 'Sacred Games' wasn't even a TV show, it was for an OTT platform," he added. "You can stay relevant as a person if you keep your thoughts new...updated," Saif stated.

221.title: 5 masked men enter Maharashtra bank with swords, video surfaces
221.article_body: Five masked men entered a bank with swords in Maharashtra's Nanded. A video of the incident was shared by News18 Lokmat. Locals and bank employees managed to catch one man, reports said. The incident took place in the Sindhi area of the Umri district. The video was retweeted by several people.

222.title: 14-year-old boy tied to pole and beaten over suspicion of theft in Karnataka
222.article_body: A 14-year-old Dalit boy was tied to a pole and thrashed by locals over suspicion of stealing earrings in Karnataka's Chikkaballapur. "They asked us which caste we belong to and said that people of our caste shouldn't live in their village and that we should all be killed," said the boy's mother, who was also attacked. Three people were arrested.

223.title: In high-scoring Aus series, Axar was at his economical best: Ashwin
223.article_body: Praising Axar Patel, Ravichandran Ashwin said the 28-year-old has impressed with his orthodox left-arm spin bowling in a world where the focus is on mystery spin, googly and wrist spin. "In a high-scoring series [vs Australia], he was at his economical best...Pure value for putting the ball where he wants to and varying his pace, line and length," added Ashwin.

224.title: Locals stage protest in Delhi's Sunder Nagri after 25-yr-old murdered
224.article_body: After the murder of a 25-year-old man in Delhi's Sunder Nagri area, angry locals staged a protest demanding a speedy probe into the matter. A police force has been deployed in the area as a precautionary measure to avoid any untoward situation. According to Delhi Police, the motive behind the murder seems to be an old enmity.

225.title: Moderna refused China's request to provide vaccine tech: Report
225.article_body: Moderna had refused to provide China with the intellectual property behind the development of mRNA vaccine, citing commercial and safety concerns, according to the Financial Times. The report said that Moderna had "given up" on efforts to access the Chinese market because of the country's demand to hand over the technology as a prerequisite for selling it in the country.

226.title: TV actress Anaya Soni suffers kidney failure, says 'Condition is serious'
226.article_body: TV actress Anaya Soni, who has featured in shows like 'Crime Patrol', took to Instagram to reveal she has suffered kidney failure. She said she will get hospitalised on Monday, adding, "My creatinine have come to 15.76 and hemoglobin is 6.7. Condition is serious." She stated, "[I'll] soon have to go with my kidney transplant...Will apply for kidney post dialysis."

227.title: Sunil Mittal praises Mukesh Ambani, says 'We had to run very fast to catch up on 4G'
227.article_body: Bharti Airtel's Sunil Mittal has praised rival company Reliance Jio's efforts to push 4G technology in India. "I would like to remind Mukesh (Ambani) when he gave a lot of pace to 4G and we had run very fast to catch up with it," he acknowledged. He further said the country's pulse didn't stop for a minute when COVID-19 hit.

228.title: Rare Hermès 'Himalaya' bag sells for ₹2.8 crore at auction; pics surface
228.article_body: A rare Hermès Himalaya Retourné Kelly 25 bag was sold for €352,800 (more than ₹2.8 crore) at a Sotheby's auction in Paris. The handbag, in 'mother-of-pearl white' colour, is reminiscent of a snowy mountain landscape. It is "one of the hardest bags to obtain" in a Hermès boutique, a Sotheby's executive said.

229.title: Apple adds iPhone 6 to its 'vintage' products list
229.article_body: Apple has added iPhone 6 to its list of vintage products as it has been over five years since it was last offered for sale. The iPhone 6 Plus was added to the list earlier this year. Apple has moved the 2012 iPod nano 7 and the fifth-generation iPod touch from the vintage list to the obsolete list.

230.title: 31-yr-old man kills wife at Hyderabad lodge over suspicion of affair
230.article_body: A 31-year-old security guard allegedly strangulated his 21-year-old wife to death at a lodge on Saturday over suspicion of an affair with his brother in Hyderabad’s Afzalgunj. The man checked into the lodge with the victim and allegedly killed her, police said. Later, he walked into the police station and surrendered.

231.title: Sidhu Moosewala murder accused gangster Tinu escapes police custody: Reports
231.article_body:
Gangster Deepak Tinu, an accused in the Sidhu Moosewala murder case, escaped police custody in Punjab's Mansa district on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday, according to reports. 
"We are working on it, police parties are on the job and we will catch him soon," reports quoted police as saying. Tinu is a close aide of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi.

232.title: Will re-evaluate safety: Indonesia minister as 174 die in football match stampede
232.article_body: Indonesia's Youth and Sports Minister Zainudin Amali said on Sunday that authorities will re-evaluate safety at football matches as the death toll from a stampede and riot at a match in East Java rose to 174. "This is a regrettable incident that injures our football at a time when supporters can watch football matches from the stadium," he added.

233.title: Meghalaya HC grants bail to BJP leader accused of running sex racket
233.article_body: The Meghalaya High Court granted conditional bail to BJP state Vice President Bernard N Marak, who is accused of running a sex racket at his farmhouse. The court directed Marak not to abscond or tamper with evidence and to cooperate in the investigation. He was also asked to furnish a personal bond of ₹50,000.

234.title: Google Translate discontinued in mainland China due to 'low usage'
234.article_body: Google has discontinued Google Translate in mainland China "due to low usage". Earlier, reports said Google had disabled access to the service in parts of China, redirecting visitors to the Hong Kong domain. The reports added that it had swapped the Translate interface at translate.google.cn with a generic Google Search page.

235.title: 3-day-old body of man found in bathroom of a PG in Bengaluru
235.article_body: The body of a 24-year-old man was found in a bathroom of a paying guest (PG) facility in Bengaluru, nearly three days after he died, the police said. The deceased, identified as HS Anil Kumar, used to work as a writer in a private firm and lived in a PG at Govindaraja Nagar. Kumar's body was found by housekeeping staff.

236.title: Free & quality education should be arranged for every child: Sisodia
236.article_body: Deputy CM of Delhi Manish Sisodia said arrangements for free and quality education should be made for every child in the country. "Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and I have a dream that every child of Delhi should get a wonderful school to study, where they should be given world-class education free of cost," Sisodia added.

237.title: NASA pushes Artemis I launch to Nov after Hurricane Ian delays launch
237.article_body: NASA is now planning to launch the Artemis l mission between November 12-27. The announcement comes after Hurricane Ian scrubbed its plans to launch the mission on September 27. The storm forced NASA to roll Artemis l off the launch pad at Florida's Kennedy Space Center. The facility was hit by the hurricane in which Artemis l suffered no damage.

238.title: UN chief asks people to 'embrace peace' on int'l non-violence day
238.article_body: UN Secretary-General António Guterres on the occasion of International Day of Non-Violence on Sunday said that on this day, "we celebrate Mahatma Gandhi's birthday and values of peace, respect and the essential dignity shared by everyone." He added that by embracing these values and working across cultures and borders, "we can defeat today's challenges...to build a better future".

239.title: Suryakumar's purple patch can't be described in words: Ashwin
239.article_body: Speaking on his YouTube channel, spinner Ravichandran Ashwin said Suryakumar Yadav's purple patch can't be described in words. "We have Maxwell, Neesham, Pollard, Tim David, Hardik and Karthik on the world's best finishers list...But Suryakumar has the best strike rate amongst them," added Ashwin. Notably, Suryakumar has already recorded the most T20I runs among Indians in 2022 (732 runs).

240.title: Concerns about functioning of SC collegium can’t be brushed aside: Ex-CJI
240.article_body: Ex-CJI NV Ramana said concerns raised in different quarters, including by the government, relating to functioning of the Supreme Court collegium system cannot be brushed aside. The Supreme Court passed a series of judgments declaring the collegium system necessary to ensure independence of the judiciary but judiciary is merely one of the many players involved in the process, he added.

241.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann breaks into bhangra at garba event in Gujarat, video goes viral
241.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister and AAP leader Bhagwant Mann took part in a garba event in Rajkot, Gujarat on Saturday. In a video that has gone viral on social media, Mann is seen breaking into bhangra after a few steps of garba on public request. Aam Aadmi Party MP Raghav Chadha also participated in a garba event in Vadodara.

242.title: 66 e-scooters, 132 batteries stolen from warehouse in Gurugram
242.article_body: A total of 66 e-scooters, 132 batteries and several chargers were stolen from a warehouse of a logistics company in Gurugram's Sector 52, police officials said. The suspects tried to take away more vehicles as 18 of them were either found to be damaged or with their locks broken, the police added. An FIR has been registered against unidentified suspects.

243.title: Bihar Agriculture Minister Sudhakar Singh, who criticised his own government, resigns
243.article_body: Bihar Agriculture Minister Sudhakar Singh, who had recently criticised his own government's policies, has resigned. Singh had said that there is no wing of the state Agricultural Department that does not commit acts of theft.  He had also called himself a "sardar of thieves". Later, he had said that he stood by his words and will not amend his statement.

244.title: Huge avalanche hits Nepal's Manaslu Base Camp; video surfaces
244.article_body: A video of a huge avalanche hitting the Manaslu Base Camp in Nepal on Sunday has surfaced online. This is the second avalanche to take place in Nepal since the one that occurred on September 26 left two persons dead. A person who was trying to climb Mount Manaslu said that there were no human casualties, reported ANI.

245.title: Richa Chadha & Ali Fazal share pics from their phool haldi, mehendi events
245.article_body: Actors Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal on Sunday took to their respective Instagram handles to share photos from their mehendi, phool haldi and sangeet ceremonies held at Delhi's Gymkhana Club on Friday. They will reportedly get married in the first week of October and later host their reception at a contemporary furniture store inside a 176-year-old mill in Mumbai.

246.title: Vote for Kharge if satisfied with Congress' working: Tharoor
246.article_body: Ahead of Congress Presidential poll, party leader Shashi Tharoor said this isn't a battle. "I'm saying that if you're satisfied with the party's working, vote for [Mallikarjun] Kharge sahab. If you want a change, I'm there but there's no ideological problem," Tharoor added. Tharoor and party veteran Mallikarjun Kharge are contesting the election, scheduled on October 17.

247.title: Deaths due to stampede, riot after football match in Indonesia rise to 174
247.article_body: The death toll due to stampede and riot after a football match in Indonesia's East Java has risen to 174, authorities said on Sunday. Police said that when supporters of the losing home team invaded the pitch to express their frustration, officers fired tear gas in an attempt to control the situation, triggering a stampede and cases of suffocation.

248.title: Gehlot backs Mallikarjun Kharge in Congress chief poll, says Tharoor from 'elite class'
248.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Sunday said that Mallikarjun Kharge has the experience to strengthen the Congress and would emerge as a clear winner in the party presidential poll, while Shashi Tharoor belongs to the "elite class". "Kharge has a clean heart, he comes from the Dalit community...Tharoor is a class apart, he is from elite class," Gehlot said.

249.title: Traffic restrictions announced in parts of Mumbai for Durga idol immersions
249.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police issued traffic restrictions and directions that will be enforced across the city on October 5 and 6 for Durga idol immersions. As per the advisory, more than 20 key roads in the city, especially in South Mumbai and Eastern Suburbs, will be closed for normal vehicular movement and only vehicles carrying idols will be allowed.

250.title: Chinese billionaire settles allegation of raping 21-yr-old hours before trial in US
250.article_body: Chinese e-commerce giant JD.com's billionaire Founder Richard Liu agreed to settle a rape lawsuit less than 48 hours before a trial was set to begin in US. A former college student had accused Liu of raping her after a dinner with wealthy Chinese executives in 2018. She was 21 at the time and had attended the dinner as a volunteer.

251.title: There's no like-for-like replacement for Bumrah in world, leave alone India: Watson
251.article_body: Ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has said Jasprit Bumrah's absence will make it "all the more difficult" for India to win the 2022 T20 WC. "There's no like-for-like replacement for Bumrah in the world, leave alone India," stated Watson. Meanwhile, India coach Rahul Dravid has said they're waiting for the "official confirmation" on Bumrah being completely ruled out of the tournament.

252.title: Kerala LoP Satheesan extends support to Kharge in party polls
252.article_body: Kerala Leader of Opposition VD Satheesan extended his support to Mallikarjun Kharge for the Congress’ Presidential polls instead of Shashi Tharoor. "I have decided to support Mallikarjun Kharge. He is a very senior politician and a senior congressman...He belongs to the Dalit community. I am very happy that a Dalit leader will be elected President of the AICC," said Satheesan.

253.title: Maha govt order asks officials to say Vande Mataram instead of hello on calls from today
253.article_body: Maharashtra government on Saturday issued Government Resolution, making it mandatory for employees working in government and government-funded institutions to say ‘Vande Mataram’ instead of ‘hello’ while receiving phone calls from government officials and citizens. The campaign will be launched in Maharashtra on Sunday. Officials have also been asked to create awareness to use ‘Vande Mataram’.

254.title: Will repatriate illegal money from Swiss banks: Kejriwal in Gujarat
254.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal stated that those involved in "corruption" under the BJP government in Gujarat have parked their money in "Swiss banks" and his party will bring it back if it is voted to power in the state. The AAP national convenor has also promised the construction of 20,000 mohalla clinics on the lines of Delhi, across Gujarat.

255.title: UP CM pays floral tributes to Mahatma Gandhi, asks people to wear khadi
255.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath paid floral tributes to Mahatma Gandhi in Lucknow on the occasion of Mahatma's 153rd birth anniversary. "Gandhi ji had made an invaluable contribution to the independence of the country by uniting the people in the thread of unity...People must wear at least one khadi product," said the CM.

256.title: Unkind commentary never ends: Mahira on criticism for attending awards amid Pak floods
256.article_body: Actress Mahira Khan responded to a Twitter user after the latter criticised her for attending an award show in Canada amid Pakistan's floods and remarked that she would later donate her dresses. Mahira tweeted, "It's never ok for us...If it makes you happy, I can take some pictures while at it...But then it'll be...showing off doing charity...Unkind commentary never ends."

257.title: Bomb threat on IndiGo flight at Mumbai airport turns out to be a hoax
257.article_body: A threat email warning of a bomb on an IndiGo flight was received at Mumbai airport on Saturday, the Mumbai Police said. However, during the inspection of the flight, nothing was found in it, the Mumbai Police informed on Sunday. The IndiGo flight, which was scheduled to go to Ahmedabad from Mumbai, was delayed after the bomb threat.

258.title: Pained by Suzlon Founder's demise, he was a pioneering business leader: PM Modi
258.article_body: PM Narendra Modi condoled the demise of Suzlon Founder Tulsi Tanti who passed away at the age of 64 after suffering a cardiac arrest on Saturday. "Tanti was a pioneering business leader who contributed to India's economic progress and strengthened our nation's efforts to further sustainable development. Pained by his untimely demise," PM Modi wrote on Twitter.

259.title: Woman constable injured after falling off T'gana CM's convoy, video surfaces
259.article_body: A female constable fell out of a car that was moving in Telangana Chief Minister KCR's convoy. She sustained minor injuries, reports said. A video of incident was shared online. The incident took place during KCR's latest visit to Warangal. In the video, the constable can be seen falling off the car and then getting up and running after it.

260.title: PM Modi offers condolences to US Prez as 51 die due to Hurricane Ian
260.article_body: PM Narendra Modi offered his "sincere condolences and heartfelt sympathies" to United States President Joe Biden as the death toll due to Hurricane Ian rose to 51 in the country. Of the total deaths, 47 deaths were reported from Florida. "Our thoughts are with the people of the United States in these difficult times, " PM Modi added.

261.title: 51 killed in US due to Hurricane Ian, Biden to visit Florida on Wednesday
261.article_body: At least 51 people, 47 in Florida and four in North Carolina, have died due to Hurricane Ian. The Category 4 hurricane, one of the strongest to hit US, flooded roadways and damaged bridges. Nearly one million homes and businesses were without electricity on Saturday. US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden will travel to Florida on Wednesday.

262.title: PM Modi requested both Zelenskyy & Putin for ceasefire during evacuation: EAM
262.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar praised PM Modi for his leadership and stated that the PM had requested a ceasefire during the evacuation process from Ukrainian President Zelenskyy and Russian President Vladimir Putin. "PM used to hold back-to-back rallies in UP...and in the evening he used to take updates on the rescue operation," said Jaishankar.

263.title: Mourinho watches Roma's game from team bus after being banned in last game
263.article_body: Roma coach Jose Mourinho shared pictures of him watching his side's game against Inter Milan from their team bus parked outside the stadium. Notably, Mourinho was banned from being present during the game after he stormed onto the pitch and received a red card in their 0-1 defeat against Atalanta last month. Roma beat Inter Milan 2-1.

264.title: Aus criticises Optus for data leak that affected 40% population
264.article_body: The Australian government has criticised its second-biggest telecom firm, Optus, for a cybersecurity breach that affected 10 million accounts, almost 40% of the nation's population. "We should not be in the position we're in, but Optus has put us here," Home Minister Clare O'Neil told a news conference. An unidentified person said they released personal information of 10,000 Optus customers.

265.title: Flooding due to heavy rains leaves 8 dead in Venezuela; 3 missing
265.article_body: At least eight people died and three others are missing after heavy rainfall caused flooding in Venezuela, authorities said. The deceased were among a group of 10 people who were holding a gathering in Tachira and were swept away from an improvised camp, authorities added. Parts of Venezuela have been witnessing heavy rainfall for at least a week.

266.title: I'm not sure an average person can tell you what metaverse is: Apple CEO
266.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook in a recent interview said, "I'm...not sure the average person can tell you what the metaverse is." At the same time, he noted that virtual reality is "something you can really immerse yourself in". Cook added, "[It] can be used in a good way...But I don't think you want to live your whole life that way."

267.title: 25-yr-old stabbed '60 times' by 3 men as bystanders watch in Delhi; act caught on camera
267.article_body: A 25-year-old man identified as Manish died after he was allegedly stabbed 60 times by three men in Delhi's Sunder Nagri. A video of the incident showed the bystanders watching as the accused attacked Manish. Police said the motive of the murder seemed to be an old enmity and arrested three main suspects named Aalam, Bilal and Faizan.

268.title: India reports 3,375 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 37,444
268.article_body: India reported 3,375 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to data by Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The data showed that 4,206 people recovered in the last 24 hours following which the active COVID-19 cases in the country stood at 37,444. This comes a day after the country recorded 3,805 fresh COVID-19 cases.

269.title: 40-60 startups to be sustainably profitable in 3 yrs: Bikhchandani
269.article_body: Info Edge Founder Sanjeev Bikhchandani has said that 40 to 60 venture capital-funded tech startups in India would be sustainably profitable in the next three years. "It isn't all gloom and doom," he added. In April, the investor said that these days, it is desirable for highly educated and qualified people to aspire to take up entrepreneurship.

270.title: Hyd Police issues traffic diversion for CM KCR's visit to Gandhi Hospital
270.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police imposed traffic restrictions on roads near Gandhi Hospital as CM K Chandrashekar Rao will visit the hospital for Gandhi statue inauguration today. The traffic restriction will stay in place from 9 am to 1 pm. The police asked people to avoid roads surrounding Gandhi Hospital and suggested commuters to take alternate routes to reach their destinations.

271.title: 5G technology will transform every Indian's life: MoS IT
271.article_body: Union Minister of State for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar on Saturday said that 5G technology will transform the life of every Indian. "The launch of 5G will have a lasting impact. It will be the future of the internet," Chandrasekhar added. "5G will bring a change to each person's life be it small businessmen, farmers, doctors or students," he stated.

272.title: New Zealand welcomes back indigenous remains stolen in 19th century
272.article_body: New Zealand's national museum, Te Papa, on Sunday welcomed back the remains of around 64 of the country's indigenous people, which were stolen in the 19th century, from Austria. The Maori and Moriori skeletal remains were "mostly taken by Austrian taxidermist and grave robber Andreas Reischek", the museum said. In July, a UK museum returned 113 remains to New Zealand.

273.title: Credit Suisse is at a critical moment: CEO to staff as shares near record-low
273.article_body: Credit Suisse CEO Ulrich Korner in a memo to his staff said that the bank is at a "critical moment" and asked them to not confuse the "day-to-day" stock price performance with the firm's "strong capital base and liquidity position". Notably, its shares are near record-low. "We're in the process of reshaping Credit Suisse for a long-term," added Korner.

274.title: India trying to give opportunities to all members of T20 WC squad: Karim
274.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Saba Karim has praised the Indian management for giving opportunities to all members of the T20 World Cup squad in the T20Is against South Africa and Australia. He added giving chances will keep the youngsters fit and in form for the World Cup. Notably, Deepak Chahar, who's part of the standbys, played in the first South Africa T20I.

275.title: Not seeking outstanding loan payment: Bankrupt crypto firm Celsius
275.article_body: US-based crypto lender Celsius Network has said it is not seeking payment of outstanding loans. In a filing at the US Bankruptcy Court, the firm mentioned that no interest or penalties will be assessed after loan maturity. In July, the fintech platform filed for bankruptcy with estimated assets and liabilities between $1 billion to $10 billion.

276.title: If I cover my head, why are Muslim girls being stopped: Sikh woman petitioner in hijab case
276.article_body: Charanjeet Kaur, a 46-year-old Sikh woman from Haryana, is the only non-Muslim petitioner among the 23 petitioners fighting against the Hijab ban in the Supreme Court. She said, "I can wear this turban...So why are the hijabi girls being stopped from wearing the hijab?" She added, "When there's fire in someone else's home, it can spread to our home too."

277.title: Kharge's confidence is good: Tharoor ahead of Cong Presidential poll
277.article_body: Ahead of Congress Presidential poll, party leader Shashi Tharoor on Saturday said that he stood for change and progress. "Mallikarjun Kharge's confidence is good. I am also confident that there are people who will listen to me too," Tharoor added. Party veteran Kharge and Tharoor are contesting the election, scheduled on October 17.

278.title: Bullet fired from ground pierces through plane mid-air, hits man in Myanmar
278.article_body: A Myanmar National Airlines plane passenger was shot mid-air after a bullet fired from the ground pierced through the plane's fuselage. The plane carrying 63 passengers was flying at an altitude of 3,500 feet and was about to land when it was hit, according to reports. A picture showed the victim holding a tissue to his neck and cheek.

279.title: Brighton hold Liverpool, Chelsea beat Crystal Palace in EPL
279.article_body: Liverpool were held to a 3-3 draw by Brighton as Leandro Trossard became the third player to score a hat-trick against Liverpool at the Anfield stadium in the English Premier League (EPL). Meanwhile, Chelsea secured their first win in the EPL under coach Graham Potter as they came from behind to beat Crystal Palace 2-1. Everton and Newcastle registered wins.

280.title: Woman RTO officer assaulted in Pune, bike rider booked
280.article_body: A bike taxi rider of an online aggregator company was booked by Pune police for physically assaulting a woman Assistant Regional Transport Officer in Vishrantwadi. The female officer sustained major injuries and was rushed to a private hospital for medical treatment. According to police, a squad of RTO officers was tracking an illegally operating bike taxi service in the city.

281.title: Old bridge in Pune's Chandani Chowk area demolished through controlled explosion
281.article_body: Edifice Engineering demolished an old bridge in the Chandani Chowk area of Pune in the early hours of Sunday through controlled explosion. Following the demolition, several earthmover machines and trucks were pressed into action to bring down the hanging structures and lift away the debris. A flyover will be constructed in its place to ease the traffic movement.

282.title: Have been sitting at home for last 4 years, not getting much work: Sajid Khan
282.article_body: Filmmaker Sajid Khan revealed that he has been sitting at home for the last four years and is not getting much work. Sajid, who is set to be a contestant in Bigg Boss' new season, said that he took up the offer to understand himself better. Earlier, several women had accused Sajid Khan of sexual misconduct during the #MeToo movement.

283.title: I said food was boring, Ranbir got me food next day; I started crying: Rashmika
283.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna said that actor Ranbir Kapoor got her breakfast the day after she said that her food was boring. "I started crying. I am like 'How can the same food be so good? I am sorry but this is too good'. He is like, 'Why are you eating that boring food?'," she added.

284.title: NMMC plans to cut 194 trees in Navi Mumbai for flyover work
284.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) is planning to cut 194 trees to clear the way for a proposed flyover at the level crossing passing through Juinagar. The administration has identified around 300 trees obstructing the proposed flyover. According to NMMC, 194 trees are required to be axed and they are awaiting clearance from the tree authority.

285.title: Arrest warrant issued against Imran Khan for threatening judge
285.article_body: A court in Pakistan's Islamabad on Saturday issued an arrest warrant for the country's former PM Imran Khan for allegedly threatening a female judge at a rally in August. Last month, the court removed terror-related charges from the case. Pakistan's Interior Minister Rana Sana Ullah Khan told Geo News that the warrant was "routine and bailable".

286.title: Swing ride crashes at Ramlila event in Ghaziabad, 4 injured
286.article_body: Four people, including two children, were injured when a swing ride generally referred as 'break dance' swing crashed at Ghantaghar Ramlila Maidan in Ghaziabad on Friday. "One of the cabins suddenly got detached and fell off. Several people of a family sustained minor injuries but they did not lodge any police complaint," SHO Amit Kumar said.

287.title: 'Dream merchant' Kejriwal peddling lies during Guj poll campaign: Smriti Irani
287.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani called Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal a "dream merchant from Delhi" who is peddling "new dreams and lies" in Gujarat during campaigning for the upcoming polls. "He's visiting Gujarat with darkness but he must listen carefully that there is so much light of development in Gujarat that he will go blind," Irani added.

288.title: Neobanking crypto startup Juno raises $18 mn led by ParaFi Capital
288.article_body: Neobanking crypto startup Juno has secured $18 million in a Series A funding round led by ParaFi Capital's Growth Fund. The funding round saw participation from Abstract Ventures, 6th Man Ventures, Jump Crypto, Greycroft and Hashed, among others. In April 2020, the startup had raised $3 million in a seed funding round led by Sequoia India's accelerator programme, Surge.

289.title: 1GB data cost ₹300 in India earlier, it has now come down to ₹10 per GB: PM Modi
289.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, during the launch event of 5G technology services in the country, said that 1GB data cost about ₹300 earlier. It has come down to about ₹10 per GB now, he stated. "On average, a person in India consumes 14GB (data) per month. This would have cost about ₹4,200 per month but costs ₹125-150," PM Modi added.

290.title: Amitabh is grumpiest, he says 'Have to go': Jaya on Big B around her friends
290.article_body: On a podcast with daughter Shweta Bachchan and granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda, Jaya Bachchan said that actor-husband Amitabh Bachchan is reserved around her friends. "Your nana is like, he is the grumpiest. He will say 'I have to go up, excuse me, ladies. If you don't mind'. Actually, they are quite happy that he is not there," she told Navya.

291.title: Only green firecrackers allowed in Chandigarh on Diwali from 8 pm to 10 pm
291.article_body: Chandigarh administration has allowed the sale and use of only green firecrackers that are certified by CSIR-NEERI. The administration has also said that the use of firecrackers would be allowed strictly from 8 pm to 10 pm on Diwali. An order by the administration said that the joined firecrackers, even if falling under the green category, have been banned.

292.title: Don't think India will make changes in batting unit for 2nd SA T20I: Jaffer
292.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said India are unlikely to make changes in their batting unit for the second South Africa T20I as the current top four are "going to be the same" for T20 World Cup in Australia. Jaffer, however, added that SA might drop Tristan Stubbs and open with Reeza Hendricks. The second T20I will be played today.

293.title: Musk to provide Starlink satellites to help Florida after hurricane
293.article_body: After Hurricane Ian hit US' Florida, the state Governor Ron DeSantis said on Saturday that SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has agreed to provide the company's satellite internet service, Starlink, to help parts of the state which have no connectivity. "[The company is] positioning those Starlink satellites to provide good coverage in Southwest Florida and other affected areas," he added.

294.title: Twitter user asks Musk his secret to staying healthy, he replies, 'Fasting'
294.article_body: A Twitter user while sharing Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s photo, asked him, ''What’s your secret? You look awesome, fit, ripped and healthy. Lifting weights? Eating healthy?'' To which Musk replied, ''Fasting.'' Replying to another user, Musk also said that he has been working out a little. The world's richest person recently revealed that he has been practising intermittent fasting.

295.title: PM Modi pays tribute to Mahatma Gandhi, Lal Bahadur Shastri on birth anniversaries
295.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday paid tribute to Mahatma Gandhi on the occasion of Gandhi Jayanti at Rajghat. "I…urge you all to purchase Khadi and handicrafts products as a tribute to Gandhi Ji," PM Modi tweeted. The Prime Minister also paid tribute to former PM Lal Bahadur Shastri on his birth anniversary at Vijay Ghat today.

296.title: Suzlon Founder Tulsi Tanti passes away aged 64 due to cardiac arrest
296.article_body: Tulsi Tanti, the Founder and Chairman of renewable energy company Suzlon Energy, passed away at the age of 64 after suffering from a cardiac arrest on Saturday, the company said. Tanti suffered a cardiac arrest soon after he landed in Pune while travelling from Ahmedabad, Times of India reported. He was reportedly in Ahmedabad to announce Suzlon's ₹1,200-crore rights issue.

297.title: Will hold back salary of BBMP engineers if encroachment removal delayed: HC
297.article_body: The Karnataka High Court warned Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) that if work of encroachment removal is delayed, the court may have to hold back salary of its engineers who are responsible for the demolition drives. The court further warned that an appropriate order will have to be issued against BBMP's Chief Commissioner if the work isn't completed on time.

298.title: 80-yr-old man, 75-yr-old wife die after fire due to AC in their Delhi house
298.article_body: An 80-year-old man and his 75-year-old wife were killed in a fire that broke out inside their house in Delhi. Police said that an air conditioner was the probable cause of the fire. "When police and fire service reached...they broke open the door and...found two persons unconscious...They shifted to Hedgewar Hospital where they were declared brought dead," the DCP said.

299.title: Video shows riot, massive stampede that killed 129 inside football stadium in Indonesia
299.article_body: A video surfaced online showing riot and massive stampede inside a football stadium in Indonesia that led to 129 deaths and at least 180 people getting injured. The disaster struck when police fired tear gas after Arema FC supporters invaded the pitch to express their frustration over loss against Persebaya Surabaya. In the video, police can be seen beating supporters.

300.title: Gandhis told me there is no 'official' candidate in Congress chief's election: Tharoor
300.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has said he was told by the Gandhi family that there is no "official" candidate in the party President's election and they will stay neutral. He also suggested he will not withdraw from the poll race, saying he cannot betray his supporters. Tharoor and party veteran Mallikarjun Kharge are contesting the election, scheduled on October 17.

301.title: When we played same XI, people were saying, 'Why don't they change': Dravid
301.article_body: India head coach Rahul Dravid has said it's "unrealistic" to have the same playing XI in all the matches. Referring to Jasprit Bumrah's injury, Dravid added, "Some of the changes or experiments...are sometimes forced upon you." He further said, "We played the same XI...[vs SA in June]. People were saying, 'Why don't they change'...so, we can't win either way."

302.title: TSSPDCL official demands ₹30,000 bribe in Hyderabad; case filed
302.article_body: A case was filed after Anti-Corruption Bureau officials caught an assistant engineer, working at Southern Power Distribution Company of Telangana (TSSPDCL) Erragadda section, who demanded a ₹30,000 bribe on Saturday in Hyderabad. The complainant claimed that he approached the accused over a defect in the electricity meter, however, the latter demanded a bribe instead of taking action.

303.title: 31 new AC local trains start service in Mumbai division
303.article_body: As many as 31 more AC local trains started service between Mumbai division's Churchgate and Virar stations from Saturday. Earlier, Western Railway had 48 AC services between the two stations and with the latest addition, the number increased to 79. Some of the new AC trains have been introduced on new routes while some others replaced the existing non-AC services.

304.title: 1 killed as 4-storey building collapses in Navi Mumbai, rescue operations on
304.article_body: One person was killed after a four-storey building collapsed in Bonkode village in Kopar Khairane of Navi Mumbai. The incident took place at around 10.30 pm on Saturday.  Fire Officer, Purushottam Jadhav, said about 32 people who were staying in the building had moved out before it collapsed. Eight others were in process of moving out when the incident happened.

305.title: 129 people killed in stampede at football match after fans invade pitch in Indonesia
305.article_body: At least 129 people were killed and 180 injured at a football match in Indonesia after a stampede during a riot, police said on Sunday. After the match between Arema FC and Persebaya Surabaya ended on Saturday night, supporters from the losing team invaded the pitch and police fired tear gas, triggering a stampede and cases of suffocation, police stated.

306.title: Russian athletes who do not back invasion of Ukraine could return to competing: IOC
306.article_body: The International Olympic Committee (IOC) is considering a return to competition of Russian athletes who do not support the country's invasion of Ukraine, IOC president Thomas Bach said on Friday. "It is not about necessarily having Russia back. It's about having athletes with a Russian passport who do not support the war back in competition," Bach said.

307.title: Venezuela releases 7 jailed Americans in prisoner swap
307.article_body: Venezuela on Saturday freed seven jailed Americans, including five oil executives, in exchange for the release of two relatives of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro, US officials said. The swap included executives of Citgo Petroleum held for years, in addition to US Marine veteran Matthew Heath and another American citizen named Osman Khan, the officials added.

308.title: Naman Ojha smashes 108* as India Legends beat SL Legends to win Road Safety World Series
308.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Naman Ojha smashed an unbeaten 108 off 71 deliveries as India Legends defeated Sri Lanka Legends in the final to win Road Safety World Series 2022. India Legends put up a total of 195/6 in their 20 overs and went on to dismiss Sri Lanka Legends for 162 in 18.5 overs. Vinay Kumar took three wickets for India Legends.

309.title: 5.9-magnitude earthquake hits Indonesia's Sumatra island, 1 killed
309.article_body: An earthquake measuring 5.9 magnitude hit Sumatra island in Indonesia on Saturday, killing one person and injuring 11 people. Over a dozen houses and buildings were damaged in the incident, police said. Two 5.0 magnitude aftershocks followed the main quake. Officials were investigating the full scale of the damage.

310.title: One of the Nord Stream pipelines has stopped leaking: Danish agency
310.article_body: The Danish Energy Agency on Saturday said one of the two Nord Stream gas pipelines, which had reported leakages recently, has stopped giving out gas. On Twitter, the agency said pressure appeared to have stabilised in the pipeline. "This indicates that the leaking of gas in this pipeline has ceased," the agency said.

311.title: Leave drones at nearby police stations: Police to Nashik residents
311.article_body: The Maharashtra Police in Nashik has ordered citizens to submit all drones to nearby police stations following two incidents of drones flying near defence establishments. Police said drones can now only be used with their permission and under their supervision by paying a fee. The order said even government-owned drones will be flown only after informing the nearby station.

312.title: 103-year-old voter felicitated by Election Dept in Himachal
312.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Electoral Officer Maneesh Garg felicitated a 103-year-old voter at the latter's residence in Chamba on International Day of Older Persons. Pyar Singh, who's the district icon for elections, has been casting his vote since 1952. All voters aged above 80 were honoured in the state with a citation signed by Chief Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar.

313.title: JDS workers egg BJP MLC's car for not inviting Kumaraswamy to K'taka event
313.article_body: A clash erupted between JDS and BJP workers in Karnataka's Ramanagara district after JDS leader HD Kumaraswamy wasn't invited at the stone-laying ceremony of development projects. JDS workers also threw eggs at BJP MLC CP Yogeshwar's car, following which police detained them. "MLC went ahead with the...ceremony without informing me. I'll take the matter up with the Speaker," Kumaraswamy said.

314.title: Life-size Mahatma Gandhi hologram gives message on education at UN
314.article_body: A life-size Mahatma Gandhi hologram has delivered a message on education at the United Nations (UN). The session was part of an Ahinsa Lecture, themed 'Education for Human Flourishing'. A voice-over was played along with the hologram projection, sharing the thoughts of Mahatama Gandhi. The International Day of Non-Violence is observed on October 2, which is the leader's birth anniversary.

315.title: Narmada water to reach all over Kutch if AAP wins in Guj: Kejriwal
315.article_body: AAP's national convenor and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal assured the people of Gujarat's Kutch that his party would "bring Narmada waters to every corner" within a year of forming the government. Kejriwal, accompanied by Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, further called the children of sitting ministers "useless". He also promised a school in every village and a hospital in every district.

316.title: Rajasthan Cong govt will complete full five-year term: CM Gehlot
316.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said the state's Congress government will complete its full five-year term and will not let the BJP topple it. "Earlier, too, the BJP tried horse trading but our MLAs were united," said Gehlot. Talking about the Congress President elections, Gehlot said "no one knew" when Rajnath Singh, Amit Shah and JP Nadda became BJP Presidents.

317.title: Raj Congress busy with political bickering: Rathore on Alwar rape
317.article_body: MP Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore said the Congress government in Rajasthan was busy with its political bickering and has no concern for the people. Talking about the alleged gangrape of a girl in Alwar, Rathore said state citizens were being "crushed" as Congress remained busy in its "power game". Criminals, extremists and separatists are emboldened due to appeasement politics, Rathore said.

318.title: Pitbull attacks 12 people across 5 villages in Punjab's Gurdaspur
318.article_body: A pitbull dog in Punjab's Gurdaspur attacked 12 people across five villages and was then killed by a retired army man and villagers in self-defence. The pitbull reportedly covered around 15 kilometres from Tango Shah village to Chuhan village, attacking people and animals on its way. The dog first attacked two labourers and then dragged a 60-year-old by his throat.

319.title: UP Police sends notice to 60 over CAA stir, seeks ₹57 lakh in damages
319.article_body: UP Police in Nahtaur has served notices to 60 people seeking ₹57 lakh in damages caused during the anti-CAA protests. Police said the mob allegedly damaged government property and set fire to a police jeep during the December 20, 2019, protests. They added that the mob attacked the police, who fired in self-defence, leading to two youths being killed.

320.title: Max could lose 2021 F1 championship over Red Bull cost cap trouble: Report
320.article_body: Red Bull F1 driver Max Verstappen could reportedly lose his 2021 world championship due to his team exceeding the year's cost cap. A report claims Red Bull exceeded the limit by $10 million, which makes it a major violation leading to points deduction or championship disqualification. "Many teams don't even have that much budget for mid-season upgrades," said the report.

321.title: 5 kg heroin recovered in J&K's Poonch district; 1 arrested
321.article_body: Punjab Police and Jammu & Kashmir (J&K) Police carried out a joint raid in J&K's Poonch district on Saturday and recovered five kilograms of heroin worth crores of rupees, officials said. A suspected drug peddler was also arrested during the raid, as per the officials. The consignment is believed to have been smuggled from across the border, officials added.

322.title: Mikel Arteta doesn't give Arsenal players much freedom: Cesc Fabregas
322.article_body: Former Arsenal FC captain Cesc Fabregas said current manager Mikel Arteta doesn't give Arsenal players the same freedom he enjoyed. "Mikel now is a little bit of 'it's his way'...it's about the way he wants the approach to be from himself, not the players," said Fabregas. Arsenal beat Tottenham Hotspur 3-1 on Saturday to stay top of the league.

323.title: Instagram introduces 'Notes' that vanish in 24 hours, Twitter users react
323.article_body: Instagram has introduced a new feature called 'Notes' which are visible to a user's followers in the DM section for 24 hours and have a 60-character limit. Followers can also respond to 'Notes'. "Instagram notes is going to be the new source of sliding in DMs," said a Twitter user. "Instagram notes...are as useless as the GPay rewards," said another.

324.title: We'll know in due course: Dravid on whether Jasprit Bumrah will play T20 World Cup 2022
324.article_body: Talking about whether Jasprit Bumrah will play T20 World Cup 2022, Team India head coach Rahul Dravid said, "He is being assessed and we'll know in due course." Dravid added, "Till he is completely ruled out till I get official confirmation that he is ruled out, we will always be hopeful. We will always hope for the best."

325.title: Haaland now fully recovered from last year's injury: Man City coach
325.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola revealed that forward Erling Haaland was struggling after surgery for his hip flexor muscle injury but has now fully recovered. "Thanks to them (physios), and of course his work ethic, he can play regularly, which last season wasn't possible," said Guardiola. Club physio Mario Pafundi travelled with the Norwegian striker during the international break.

326.title: 5G will help Uttar Pradesh become 1 trillion dollar economy: CM Yogi
326.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said 5G will lead to a qualitative improvement in the pace of work and will help the state become a one trillion dollar economy. PM Narendra Modi has started a new era of communication revolution in the country, Adityanath said. His comment comes after PM Modi launched 5G services at India Mobile Congress on Saturday.

327.title: Palestinian teenager shot dead by Israeli forces in West Bank
327.article_body: A Palestinian teenager was reportedly shot dead by Israeli forces on Saturday in the West Bank after a group of youths smashed a hole through the Israeli separation barrier and began throwing objects at police. A protester who attempted to throw a firebomb at Israeli troops was shot, border police said. Palestinian officials identified the deceased as 18-year-old Fayez Damdoum.

328.title: Iranian woman arrested for eating at restaurant without hijab, says her family
328.article_body: An Iranian woman was arrested after a picture showed her eating at a restaurant without her hijab (headscarf), her family has said. The woman Donya Rad was summoned by authorities and then arrested, CNN reported quoting her sister. Iran has seen widespread civil unrest after a 22-year-old woman was killed in police custody after being arrested for her 'improper hijab'.

329.title: Jeswin wins National Games long jump gold, qualifies for World C'ships 2023
329.article_body: Long jumper Jeswin Aldrin qualified for 2023 World Athletics Championships after he won the gold medal following his 8.26-metre jump at 36th National Games in Gujarat on Saturday. The 20-year-old long jumper's winning jump measured 0.1m above the automatic World Championships 2023 qualifying standard of 8.25m. CWG 2022 silver medallist Murali Sreeshankar won silver with a jump of 7.93m.

330.title: India winning T20 World Cup depends on Suryakumar Yadav: Brad Hogg
330.article_body: Former Australian bowler Brad Hogg said India's success in the 2022 T20 World Cup depends on Suryakumar Yadav's performance. "He is the most important player in the team as he is creative and inventive," said Hogg. He added that if India losses its top order early, then Suryakumar "sums up the situation" to give India the best chance to win.

331.title: Salman said 'get lost' when he was offered money for cameo in 'GodFather': Chiranjeevi
331.article_body: In an interview with Film Companion, Chiranjeevi revealed that Salman Khan agreed to appear in the upcoming movie 'GodFather' without reading a script and refused to take payment for his cameo. "When my producers went to him and offered him some amount...he said, 'You cannot buy my love towards Ram [Charan] and Chiranjeevi garu with money. Get lost'," Chiranjeevi added.

332.title: Drone captures footage of Mount Everest, Twitter users call it 'breathtaking'
332.article_body: Industrialist Harsh Goenka took to Twitter to share a video that shows drone footage of the view of Mount Everest, world's highest mountain. The video, posted on the official YouTube channel of tech company DJI, also gives a glimpse of some mountaineers. Some Twitter users called it "breathtaking" while other comments read, "Spectacular visuals" and "Mesmerising view".

333.title: Video of controversial run-out of India's Pooja Vastrakar goes viral, fans react
333.article_body: A video of India Women's Pooja Vastrakar's controversial run-out in the match against Sri Lanka in Asia Cup went viral. Pooja was declared out despite replays seemingly showing she was inside her crease. "How on earth is Pooja given out by...third umpire?" a fan wrote. "That is such a poor decision by the third umpire," tweeted Yuvraj Singh.

334.title: UP govt school vaccinates kids without consent, many ill: Parents
334.article_body: Around 50 students were taken to a hospital after being administered DPT vaccine at a government primary school in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh. Parents said children were locked in school and vaccinated without their parents' consent, adding that many fell ill post-vaccination. Chief Medical Officer Neeraj Tyagi said children weren't seriously ill but had suffered from routine reactions from the dose.

335.title: Over 30,000 dengue cases reported in Pakistan this year
335.article_body: As many as 30,267 cases of dengue have been reported in Pakistan this year, as of Saturday. The country's capital, Islamabad, has reportedly logged 2,435 cases thus far. The nationwide death toll due to the viral infection has reached 68. The surge in dengue cases comes in the wake of devastating floods that continue to affect several parts of Pakistan.

336.title: 23.28 lakh Indian accounts banned by WhatsApp in August
336.article_body: WhatsApp on Saturday said that it banned 23.28 lakh Indian accounts in the month of August. Of these, 10,08,000 were proactively banned, before any reports from users, WhatsApp stated. According to WhatsApp's latest report, 598 grievance reports were received, and 19 accounts were "actioned" in August. Of the total reports received, 449 pertained to 'ban appeal'.

337.title: Federer raised tennis to a higher level like Woods did with golf: Almagro
337.article_body: Ex-tennis player Nicolas Almagro has said Roger Federer's retirement is a significant loss for everything that has changed tennis since his arrival. "He raised it to a higher level as Tiger Woods did with golf or Michael Jordan with basketball," he added. "Hopefully the next generations will remain faithful to the legacy that he [Federer] leaves," he further said.

338.title: Prashant Kishor to begin 3,500-km 'padyatra' in Bihar tomorrow
338.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor will start his 3,500-km 'padyatra' on the occasion of Mahatma Gandhi's birth anniversary on Sunday from Bihar's West Champaran district. Kishor's 'padyatra' is part of his 'Jan Suraj' campaign and is expected to last for 12 to 18 months. Kishor joined the JD(U) in 2018 and was expelled from the party in 2020.

339.title: PM Modi visits ex-President Kovind on latter's 77th birthday
339.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met former President Ram Nath Kovind at the latter's residence in New Delhi on Saturday, on the occasion of Kovind's 77th birthday. Earlier, PM Modi tweeted, "Birthday greetings to Shri Ram Nath Kovind Ji. He is widely respected for his statesmanship and leadership." PM also tweeted photographs of the meeting with Kovind, his wife and daughter.

340.title: Over 20 killed as vehicle with pilgrims overturns in UP, PM expresses condolences
340.article_body: At least 22 people died and several others were injured as a vehicle carrying pilgrims met with an accident in UP's Kanpur on Saturday. The tractor trolley with dozens of pilgrims who were returning from Unnao overturned in the Ghatampur area. PM Narendra Modi condoled the deaths and announced an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh for families of the deceased.

341.title: Ex-Kerala Home Minister Kodiyeri Balakrishnan passes away at 68
341.article_body: Former Kerala Home Minister Kodiyeri Balakrishnan passed away in Chennai on Saturday at the age of 68. The veteran CPI(M) leader was diagnosed with cancer earlier and had been under treatment at Apollo Hospital. He had stepped down as party state Secretary in August due to poor health. He served as Kerala Home Minister from 2006-2011.

342.title: Once auditioned for 'Indian Idol' but wasn't selected: Kapil Sharma
342.article_body: Actor-comedian Kapil Sharma has revealed that he once auditioned for the singing reality show 'Indian Idol'. However, he wasn't selected. "Then there was this 'Indian Idol' copy 'Awaz Punjab Di' in our area where I was selected. During that very time, I also got selected for 'The Laughter Challenge'. However, I'd self-analysed and...I finally chose 'The Laughter Challenge'," said Kapil.

343.title: Ghulam Nabi Azad elected chairman of Democratic Azad Party
343.article_body: Ghulam Nabi Azad, former Chief Minister of the erstwhile state of Jammu and Kashmir, has been elected the chairman of the newly-formed Democratic Azad Party (DAP), said a party leader on Saturday. A resolution was passed unanimously at a founder members' session, said the leader. Azad, 73, quit Congress on August 26 this year.

344.title: Haridwar ranked cleanest Ganga town with population above 1 lakh
344.article_body: Haridwar has been adjudged the cleanest town along the Ganga river in the category of more than one lakh population in the Centre's latest Swachh Survekshan survey. Varanasi and Rishikesh were ranked second and third respectively. Meanwhile, Bijnor bagged the first position among Ganga towns with fewer than one lakh population. The survey focused on "cleanliness in and around Ghats".

345.title: Ex-Delhi Capitals spinner Lamichhane to surrender in rape case, says 'I am innocent'
345.article_body: Former Nepal captain and former Delhi Capitals spinner Sandeep Lamichhane has said that he will go to Nepal on October 6 and surrender himself to the authorities in a rape case of 17-year-old girl. Calling allegations against him "false", Lamichhane said, "I hereby reiterate that I am INNOCENT and I have complete non-shaken faith in justice system."

346.title: Our neighbour is an expert in 'Int'nl Terrorists', we're experts in IT: Jaishankar
346.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Saturday said that India has a neighbour who is an expert in "international terrorists" just like we're experts in information technology (IT). "We were able to make the world understand that terrorism isn't political or diplomatic," said Jaishankar. "Today it's being done against us, tomorrow it will be done against you," he added.

347.title: Nimrat attends inaugural ceremony of late father Major Bhupender's statue
347.article_body: Actress Nimrat Kaur recently travelled to Patiala for the inaugural ceremony of her late father Major Bhupender Singh's statue in Patiala regiment. A bronze statue of Major Bhupender Singh was inaugurated at the Heritage Hall at his parent regiment 64 Assault Engineer Regiment in Patiala. "It's a really special moment for us...to be here to honour his memory," Nimrat said.

348.title: Run-outs cost us the match: SL skipper Athapaththu on 41-run loss vs India
348.article_body: Sri Lanka Captain Chamari Athapaththu said the run-outs in the crucial times cost her side the match against India in Women's Asia Cup. "In the death overs, there was good bowling...The run-outs are an issue, we need to concentrate on overcoming it," she added. Sri Lanka lost by 41 runs after being bowled out for 109 in 18.2 overs.

349.title: Harshal is mentally strong, he bowled a fantastic last over vs SA: Dravid
349.article_body: Backing Harshal Patel following his comeback to the Indian team after a rib injury, India head coach Rahul Dravid stated the pacer is mentally strong and he bowled brilliantly in the last over in first T20I against South Africa. Harshal, who was ruled out of Asia Cup 2022, returned to the squad for three-match T20I series against Australia.

350.title: Himachal CM inaugurates art & craft culture centre 'Dev Lok' in Kullu
350.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur on Saturday inaugurated the art and craft culture centre 'Dev Lok' in Kullu district's Baragran Bihal, which has been constructed in PPP mode at a cost of ₹46 crore. The local artists and artisans would also get an opportunity to promote, exhibit and market their products through this unique centre, Jairam Thakur said.

351.title: List measures against police procuring vehicles illegally: HC to Meghalaya
