351.article_body: The Meghalaya High Court (HC) has asked the state's Home Secretary to submit a report on the steps that have been taken against police department officials who allegedly procured vehicles illegally. "Such (a) report should be filed when the matter appears next on October 17," the court said. The HC further asked if any arrests were made in the matter.

352.title: PM Modi is not following my advice to give brotherhood message: CM Gehlot
352.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that PM Narendra Modi is not following his "advice" to give the message of "brotherhood" to the public. "We lost as voters swayed away under the 'Modi wave'. We (Congress) were winning Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh and Rajasthan [in the 2019 general elections]...I request people to give us another chance," he said.

353.title: I would watch out for Rishabh Pant in 2nd T20I against SA: Nehra
353.article_body: Ex-Indian pacer Ashish Nehra said that he would "watch out" for wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant in the second T20I against South Africa in Guwahati on Sunday. "He (Pant) is bound to be in the playing XI now, he has a good chance with Hardik Pandya not being there...Now if he also scores runs, that will be another plus point," Nehra said.

354.title: 42-year-old man's body found buried in friend's house in Kerala
354.article_body: A 42-year-old man, who went missing last week, was found dead and buried in the house of his friend in Changanassery in Kottayam, Kerala. The body of the deceased, Bindumon, was found in a concrete-filled place of the house, police said. The house belonged to Bindumon's friend, Muthukumar, who is also missing since Friday, police added.

355.title: Comfortable with what we've got: Dravid on India's potential XI for T20 WC
355.article_body: Talking about Team India's potential playing XI for T20 World Cup, head coach Rahul Dravid said he and the team management have been pretty clear with the kind of skills they want in the players. "You can't pick them many months in advance, you won't know what we'll get...I think we are quite comfortable with what we have," he added.

356.title: Attack in Iran kills 19 including top Revolutionary Guard official
356.article_body: An attack on a police station by armed separatists on Friday killed 19 people, including four members of Iran's Revolutionary Guard Corps, state media reported. The head of the Revolutionary Guard's intelligence department was also injured in the attack and died later, state media reports said. Nearly 32 members of the corps were reportedly wounded in the clashes.

357.title: 28 Iranian journalists arrested since start of Amini protests: CPJ
357.article_body: At least 28 Iranian journalists and photographers have been arrested since the anti-regime protests started in the country two weeks ago, the Committee to Protect Journalists (CPJ) has said. The demonstrations began following the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini allegedly in police custody. Amini was arrested over her 'improper hijab'.

358.title: Salary hike order for Gadchiroli police to be issued in 2 days: Fadnavis
358.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Saturday said that an order increasing the salaries of police personnel posted in the Naxal-affected Gadchiroli district would be issued within two days. Fadnavis held a meeting of the District Planning Committee in Gadchiroli and said the decision on increasing the salaries of police personnel in the district one-and-half times was pending.

359.title: Nick Cannon becomes father for 10th time, welcomes his 3rd baby with Brittany Bell
359.article_body: Actor Nick Cannon took to social media to announce that he has welcomed his 10th child, his third baby with model Brittany Bell. "Thank you Brittany for my fellow little Libra! I love you and our incredible family!" he wrote on Instagram, sharing a video. Two weeks ago, Cannon had welcomed his ninth child, his first with photographer LaNisha Cole.

360.title: We are happy: Harmanpreet on India's 41-run win vs SL in Women's Asia Cup
360.article_body: After India's 41-run win against Sri Lanka in Women's Asia Cup, India captain Harmanpreet Kaur said her side didn't start off well. "But those crucial run-outs and we kept getting wickets. We are happy as few of our bowlers stood up, especially Deepti Sharma. After losing crucial wickets, Jemimah Rodrigues played really well," she added. Jemimah top-scored in the match.

361.title: Russian troops flee city in annexed Ukrainian region as Ukraine army surrounds them
361.article_body: Russia on Saturday said its troops had withdrawn from the key city of Lyman, located in Ukraine's Donetsk region, which was annexed by Russia recently. Russian troops fled after Ukraine's army "encircled" the city which lies 160 kilometres southeast of Kharkiv- Ukraine's second-largest city. This came a day after Russian President Vladimir Putin announced the annexation of four Ukrainian regions.

362.title: J&K administration has been a 'complete failure': NC leader
362.article_body: Provincial President of National Conference for Jammu Rattan Lal Gupta on Saturday said the Jammu and Kashmir administration has been a "complete failure". "The LG's administration has turned out to be a dummy government...with no powers of its own as...instructions are being broadcasted from New Delhi," Gupta said. He criticised the administration for not doing enough for the people.

363.title: People want to go to Hollywood, I want to go to South: Salman
363.article_body: Salman Khan, who'll make his Telugu film debut with a cameo in 'GodFather', said while many people aspire to do Hollywood films, he wants to do South films. "We say ₹300 crore, ₹400 crore. If all of us get together, we can cross ₹3,000-4,000 crore," he added. "Everyone just grows and grows and the numbers become really large," Salman stated.

364.title: Actor Annu Kapoor cheated of ₹4.36 lakh in online KYC fraud
364.article_body: Actor Annu Kapoor lost ₹4.36 lakh to an online fraudster on the pretext of getting his Know Your Customer (KYC) details updated with a leading private sector bank. The bank immediately called Annu to inform about the fraudulent transactions and told him his account was compromised. The accounts where the money was sent have been frozen.

365.title: Ben Stokes responds to Bhogle's criticism of England over Deepti Sharma controversy
365.article_body: England's Ben Stokes took to Twitter to respond to commentator Harsha Bhogle's criticism of England for targeting Deepti Sharma over mankading. Reacting to Bhogle calling it a "cultural thing", Stokes wrote, "Harsha...2019 WC final was over 2 years ago, I still till this day revive countless messages calling me all sorts from Indian fans, does this disturb you?"

366.title: 20 killed in Russian shelling of humanitarian convoy: Ukraine
366.article_body: Russian shelling hit a civilian evacuation convoy in Ukraine's Kharkiv region on Saturday, killing at least 20 people, a Ukrainian official said. It was the second Russian attack on a humanitarian convoy in two days, as per Ukrainian claims. Russian forces have reportedly withdrawn from most of Kharkiv since Ukraine mounted a counter-offensive in the region last month.

367.title: Arsenal beat 10-man Tottenham in north London derby to remain top of PL table
367.article_body: Arsenal moved four points clear at the top of the Premier League table after a 3-1 win over 10-man Tottenham Hotspur in north London derby at Emirates Stadium on Saturday. Arsenal have seven wins from eight league games this season. Thomas Partey(20'), Gabriel Jesus(49') and Granit Xhaka(67') netted for Arsenal, while Harry Kane(31') scored a penalty for Tottenham.

368.title: Man gets ₹22 lakh estimate to repair car that cost him ₹11 lakh in Bengaluru, post viral
368.article_body: A Bengaluru man claimed he was handed ₹22 lakh estimate to repair his Volkswagen car worth ₹11 lakh. He said the servicing centre charged him ₹44,840 for insurance paperwork before he could collect his car. When he contacted Volkswagen India, he was informed the charge is only ₹5,000. He stated that he finally got his car back on September 26.

369.title: It's better now: Malaika on equation with ex-husband Arbaaz Khan
369.article_body: Malaika Arora, on being asked if she continues to be friends with ex-husband Arbaaz Khan, said, "We have a better equation now." "We are far more mature. We're just happier, calmer people," she added. Calling Arbaaz a wonderful man, Malaika said, "Sometimes, people are wonderful but they just aren't great together. That's just how it is."

370.title: Wide-ranging measures will be invoked if N Korea tests nukes: US
370.article_body: The US will invoke measures spanning "multiple instruments of national power" in case North Korea conducts a nuclear test, officials with the US Indo-Pacific Command said on Friday. This came a day before North Korea conducted its fourth ballistic missile launch this week. US and South Korean officials believe that a test is likely between October 16 and November 7.

371.title: 30 ill after eating hostel food in Kota, 1 saw 'lizard in curry'
371.article_body: At least 30 girl students complained about vomiting and dizziness after eating the food served at their hostel in Rajasthan's Kota on Thursday. A student claimed she had noticed a lizard in the curry. Chief Medical Health Officer Jagdish Soni said the food was thrown out before samples could be collected for examination. He added that a probe is underway.

372.title: People should stop asking such questions: Salman on if Bigg Boss is scripted
372.article_body: Ahead of the premiere of 'Bigg Boss 16', Salman Khan opened up about the allegations that the show is scripted. "This show is [not] scripted...It would be better if people stop asking such questions," he said. "You cannot script a show like Bigg Boss. No writer in this world can write a show like Bigg Boss," Salman added.

373.title: India, South Africa would be the teams to watch out for in T20 WC: Kallis
373.article_body: Ex-Proteas all-rounder Jacques Kallis said that India and South Africa would be the teams to watch out for in the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia. "It will be an important series in India now between these two teams even though the conditions would be different," Kallis said. He added, "It will be a good WC for South Africa."

374.title: Which states are the cleanest in India as per the latest Swachh Bharat survey?
374.article_body: Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh and Maharashtra have been adjudged the first, second and third cleanest Indian states respectively by the latest Swachh Bharat survey, findings of which were released on Saturday. Tripura bagged the top rank in the category of states with less than 100 urban local bodies. This is the seventh edition of the cleanliness survey which began in 2016.

375.title: Unmukt Chand suffers serious eye injury, shares pics
375.article_body: India's 2012 Under-19 World Cup-winning captain Unmukt Chand, who plays in US' Minor League Cricket, suffered a serious eye injury while playing. He took to Twitter to share pictures, writing, "It's never a smooth ride for an athlete. Some days you come home victorious, other days disappointed & there are some when you come home with bruises and dents."

376.title: How does T20 World Cup's prize money compare with that of IPL and other leagues?
376.article_body: The winners of the men's T20 World Cup 2022 will get a prize money of ₹13.02 crore. The Indian Premier League (IPL) 2022 winners received a prize money of ₹20 crore. The winners of Pakistan Super League (PSL) 2022 got ₹3.40 crore, while Big Bash League (BBL) 2021-22 winners received ₹3.66 crore.

377.title: Wicket in Sylhet was tricky: Jemimah on her 53-ball 76 in Women's Asia Cup
377.article_body: After being adjudged 'Player of the Match' against Sri Lanka in Women's Asia Cup, India batter Jemimah Rodrigues said the wicket in Sylhet was tricky. "Initially it was not turning, but then it turned. I had prepared well for this, even in Bengaluru I asked for slower...turning wickets," she added. Jemimah top-scored in the match with her 53-ball 76.

378.title: Turkey rejects Russia's annexation of Ukrainian regions
378.article_body: Turkey on Saturday denounced Russia's annexation of four regions in Ukraine, saying that the move is a "grave violation" of international law. Russian President Vladimir Putin announced the formal annexation of Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson and Zaporizhzhia on Friday after "referendums" were held by Moscow-backed authorities there. The annexed regions account for about 15% of Ukrainian territory.

379.title: Many areas in Pune waterlogged after intense rain on Friday
379.article_body: Many areas in Pune were waterlogged after brief but intense spells of rain on Friday. From 4 pm to 6 pm on Friday, Shivajinagar received 35.1 mm of rain, Pashan received 7.2 mm of rain and Lohegaon received 9.2 mm of rain, the India Meteorological Department said. The rains caused traffic congestion and incidents of trees falling.

380.title: It will be good battle between Stokes, Pandya in T20 WC: Kallis
380.article_body: Former South African cricketer Jacques Kallis said that there will be a "good battle" between all-rounders, Hardik Pandya and Ben Stokes, in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "These two (Pandya-Stokes) are world-class all-rounders," Kallis said. He added, "All-rounders are something you need to look after [as] they don't come around often...Both of them will play a big role."

381.title: Amit Shah to embark on 2-day J&K visit from Oct 4, to review security situation
381.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah will visit Jammu and Kashmir for two days from October 4, during which he will review the security situation at a meeting to be held in Srinagar. He is also scheduled to address two rallies and offer prayers at Vaishno Devi temple. Shah will also lay foundation stones for several developmental projects in Jammu.

382.title: Where are your promises for Telangana?: KTR questions Centre
382.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao on Saturday demanded an explanation from the Centre for not fulfilling the promises made to people of Telangana. "It's a shame that not a single promise made in...AP Reorganisation Act has been kept either for Telangana or...Andhra Pradesh," KTR tweeted. He also accused Union Minister G Kishan Reddy of fooling the citizens of Telangana.

383.title: Army Captain among 3 injured in road accident in UP's Saharanpur
383.article_body: Three people, including an Army Captain, were injured after the car in which they were travelling collided with a stationary truck on a state highway in Deoband in UP's Saharanpur district. The injured, Army Captain Rohan Singh, Satyendra and Shyamsundar, were taken to a local hospital, police said. Notably, the car was going from Delhi to Punjab.

384.title: PMC's demand for more water is natural: Ajit Pawar
384.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party leader Ajit Pawar has supported the Pune Municipal Corporation's (PMC) demand for more water. The PMC has asked for approval of 20.34 thousand million cubic (TMC) feet of water for the city from the Water Resources Department. "As the population has risen, it is natural to demand more water," Pawar said.

385.title: Interfaith couple assaulted by 2 men in Bengaluru Rural district
385.article_body: An interfaith couple was allegedly assaulted by two men in Doddabalpur in Karnataka's Bengaluru Rural district. The accused, Akbar and Hujur, were booked and later, Akbar has been arrested, police said. The complaint has been registered based on a video of the incident where Hujur can be seen slapping the woman. Notably, Akbar is an electrician and recording the video.

386.title: 5G rollout will benefit education sector in a big way: Union Minister
386.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Saturday said the rollout of 5G technology in the country will benefit education in a big way. The launch of 5G telecom services will greatly help in the implementation of 'digital university' being envisioned by Education Ministry, Pradhan said. "5G will be the major vehicle to reach out to the unreachable," he added.

387.title: How does T20 World Cup's prize money compare with that of IPL and other leagues?
387.article_body: The winners of the men's T20 World Cup 2022 will get a prize money of ₹13.02 crore. The Indian Premier League (IPL) 2022 winners received a prize money of ₹20 crore. The winners of Pakistan Super League (PSL) 2022 got ₹3.40 crore, while Big Bash League (BBL) 2021-22 winners received ₹3.66 crore.

388.title: Unmukt Chand suffers serious eye injury, shares pics
388.article_body: India's 2012 Under-19 World Cup-winning captain Unmukt Chand, who plays in US' Minor League Cricket, suffered a serious eye injury while playing. He took to Twitter to share pictures, writing, "It's never a smooth ride for an athlete. Some days you come home victorious, other days disappointed & there are some when you come home with bruises and dents."

389.title: Child dies as bus crashes into car on Bengaluru-Mysuru highway
389.article_body: A child died on the spot after a speeding bus crashed into a car on Bengaluru-Mysuru highway near Channapatna, Mysuru MP Pratap Simha said on Saturday. "#SpeedKills," he tweeted. The accident involved a travel company's bus and six other cars. The bus reportedly rammed into a car, which in turn crashed into the car in front of it.

390.title: It changed my life, made a star out of dust: Jackie on 'Hero'
390.article_body: Actor Jackie Shroff, when asked about a film that changed his life, named 'Hero'. "[It] put me here from chawl. It made a star out of the dust," he added. The film, which was released in 1983, was directed by Subhash Ghai. The action-drama film also starred Sanjeev Kumar, Shammi Kapoor and Amrish Puri, among others.

391.title: PCMC postpones deadline to stop wet garbage collection from societies
391.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) said it has postponed its decision to not pick wet garbage from big housing societies starting October 2. PCMC said it would give the housing societies a month's time, till October 31, to find a solution. This comes after residential housing societies in PCMC jurisdiction threatened to dump wet garbage outside the civic headquarters.

392.title: List of cleanest Indian cities released, Indore bags top spot for the 6th time
392.article_body: MP's Indore has been ranked as the cleanest city in India by the Centre's Swachh Survekshan survey, for the sixth consecutive time. Surat in Gujarat and Navi Mumbai in Maharashtra occupy the second and third spots in the latest ranking. Visakhapatnam and Vijayawada in Andhra Pradesh have been ranked fourth and fifth cleanest cities, respectively.

393.title: 'Pushpa' changed perception of me as an actor across the country: Rashmika
393.article_body: Rashmika Mandanna said in an interview that 'Pushpa: The Rise' changed the perception of her as an actor across the country. "I was never an actor. I am still in a phase where I am exploring myself. So for me, being a public figure is still a new concept," she added. Directed by Sukumar, the film also featured Allu Arjun.

394.title: 3 arrested for child pornography on Twitter: DCW Chairperson
394.article_body: Chairperson of Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) Swati Maliwal said the police have arrested three persons in connection with child pornography content being available on Twitter. The DCW said Maliwal wrote to the Director of the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) about the matter. The statement added eight Delhi Police teams conducted nationwide raids as part of the investigation.

395.title: Final pre-demolition work on Pune's Chandani Chowk bridge completed
395.article_body: The final pre-demolition work, including the drilling of explosives and putting up of sign boards, on Pune's Chandani Chowk old bridge has been completed by the NHAI. There will be a traffic block of nine hours from 11 pm on October 1 to 8 am on October 2. Union Minister Nitin Gadkari earlier did an aerial review of the work.

396.title: 'Mr Putin, don't misunderstand what I'm saying,' warns Biden amid Ukraine war
396.article_body: As US imposed wide-ranging sanctions on Russia over its declared annexation of parts of Ukraine, President Joe Biden warned Russian President Vladimir Putin against making any threat to NATO territory. "America's fully prepared with our NATO allies to defend every single inch of NATO territory," Biden said. "So Mr Putin, don't misunderstand what I'm saying. Every inch," he stated.

397.title: Use drones to conduct geospatial mapping of Delhi: SC to Centre
397.article_body: The Supreme Court has directed the Centre to use drones to conduct the geospatial mapping of Delhi. An apex court bench of Justices AS Oka and Sanjay Kishan Kaul said geospatial mapping would help in digitising land records and checking encroachments. “This is what we had done in Chennai when I was the Chief Justice there,” Justice Kaul said.

398.title: Jemimah top-scores as India beat SL in their 1st match of Women's Asia Cup
398.article_body: India Women beat Sri Lanka Women by 41 runs in their opening match of the Women's Asia Cup 2022 in Bangladesh on Saturday. After being put to bat first, India scored 150/6 in 20 overs. In reply, Sri Lanka were all out for 109 in 18.2 overs. With a 53-ball 76, India batter Jemimah Rodrigues top-scored in the match.

399.title: Teacher stabs wife to death in front of 9-yr-old daughter in Delhi
399.article_body: A government school teacher allegedly stabbed and killed his wife in front of their nine-year-old daughter following an argument in southwest Delhi's Nawada on Friday, police said. The daughter told police that her father stabbed her mother with a knife, a senior official informed. The accused was missing when police found his wife's body at the couple's house, police added.

400.title: Health profile of every citizen of T'gana will be prepared soon: KCR
400.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Saturday said the health profile of every citizen of Telangana will be prepared soon. The initiative launched on a pilot basis in Sircilla and Mulugu has concluded, he added. Speaking after the inauguration of Prathima Cancer Hospital in Warangal, Rao said, "Details such as blood group and other parameters of every person...[will be] computerised."

401.title: Hyderabad airport issues travel advisory for festive season
401.article_body: Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport issued a traffic advisory as the number of passengers is expected to surge during the festive season. It requested those travelling out of Hyderabad to reach the airport well in advance. "A longer wait time for transportation facilities from the airport to the city is expected. Passengers can avail...transportation available at the airport," it added.

402.title: Man given 142-year jail sentence for raping minor girl for 2 years in Kerala
402.article_body: A 41-year-old man in Kerala's Pathanamthitta was sentenced to 142 years of rigorous imprisonment for raping a minor girl for two years from 2019 to 2021. The court said that this was the maximum punishment awarded to an accused under POCSO Act by it, adding that the man will undergo 60 years of imprisonment. He's also been fined ₹5 lakh.
